content.content: 観象台
a meteorological observatory

〈名〉Admiration:(=する) to admire

content:
かんしょう〔鑑賞〕

content.content: 詩を鑑賞する
to appreciate poetry

content:
かんしょう〔奸商〕
〈名〉A dishonest merchant

content.content: 奸商が暴利をむさぼる
Dishonest merchants profiteer.

かんしょう〔癇症〕
〈名〉Irritability of the nerves

content:
かんじょう〔勘定〕
〈名〉
1. (=計算)counting; calculation; reckoning; computation; estimate; accounts; figures:(=する) to count; to calculate; to reckon; to compute; to estimate; to cast accounts

content.content: 金を勘定する
to count money
金を勘定して受取ったか
Did you count the money when you received it?
彼は勘定が上手だ
He is good at figures―quick at accounts.
僕は勘定が下手だ
I am a poor hand at figures―slow at accounts.
勘定に入れる
to take anything into account―take account of anything
勘定に入れぬ
to take no account of anything―leave anything out of account
軍艦を比較するには艦齢を勘定に入れなければならぬ
In comparing ships, we must take their age into account―take account of their age.
古い船は勘定に入れなくともさしつかえ無い
We may leave the old ships out of account―We need not take account of the old ships.
古い船は勘定に入らぬ
The old ships count for nothing.
勘定に目を通す
to look over the accounts
勘定を読み合わせる
to verify accounts―adjust accounts
勘定が合っている
The accounts are right―The accounts balance.
勘定が違っている
The accounts are wrong.
勘定を間違える
to make a mistake in calculation―miscalculate
勘定違い
a miscalculation
勘定が厳重だ
The accounts are exact (to the cent).
金額を勘定すると月二千円の割になる
The account works out at 2,000 yen a month.
ざっと勘定しても一万円はかかる
It will cost 10,000 yen at a rough estimate.
勘定のできない
countless stars―incalculable benefits, etc.
勘定高い
to be exact in accounts
西洋人は勘定高い
Foreigners stand upon their rights.
勘定方
an accountant
勘定早見表
a ready reckoner

content: 2. (=銀行などの勘定)account

content.content: 当座勘定
current account
別勘定
special account

content: 3. (=勘定書)a bill; one's account; one's score; one's reckoning

content.content: 勘定を払う
to pay the bill―foot the bill―settle the bill―settle one's account―settle one's score―pay one's reckoning
誰が勘定を持つか
Who will pay the bill?
勘定をして下さい
Please make out my bill.
姐さん、勘定
Waitress, have my bill made out.
勘定を命ずる
to call for one's bill
勘定はいくらになるか
What does the account come up to?―What is the reckoning?―What is to pay?
目の玉の抜けるような勘定
a bouncing bill
勘定がすんだ
The account is settled―The bill is paid.
勘定ずみ
Settled.
品物は宛名へ届けて僕の勘定に書き出せ
Send the article to the address, and charge it to my account―put it down to my account.
洋服屋が勘定を取りに来た
The tailor has come to have his bill paid―to collect his bill.
勘定取り
a bill-collector
勘定をいくら取ったか
What did they charge you?
勘定を二重に取る
to charge one twice for the same thing
ぜひ勘定のお払いを願います
I must have my little bill paid.
方々の勘定をためた
I have run up bills at various houses.

content: 4. (=勘定を払うこと)settlement of accounts; payment of bills:(=する) to pay the bill; to settle one's account; to settle accounts (with one); to square accounts (with one); to settle (with one); to reckon (with one); to pay (one)

content.content: 勘定はいくらか
What's to pay?
僕が勘定しておいた
I have paid the bill―settled the account.
お勘定を願います
I wish to have my little bill paid.
君に勘定しなけりゃならない
I must settle accounts with you―settle with you―reckon with you―pay you.
大晦日には年中の勘定をする
All accounts are settled on New Year's Eve.
親子の間も勘定は勘定
“Business is business.”
勘定日
the pay-day―the settling day―the settlement-day―the day of reckoning

content:
かんじょう〔干城〕
〈名〉A defender; a bulwark

content.content: 陸海軍は国家の干城なり
The army and navy are the bulwarks of the State.
兵は国家の干城である
Soldiers are the defenders of the State.

content:
かんじょう〔感情〕
〈名〉One's feelings; one's susceptibilities; emotion; sentiment; impulse

content.content: 感情を表す
to show one's feelings―betray one's emotion―express one's sentiments
人の感情を害す
to hurt one's feelings―offend one's susceptibilities―wound one's pride
彼の感情を害さぬように注意せよ
Be careful not to hurt his feelings―Be careful to spare his feelings.
彼は感情を害している
His feelings are hurt―He feels hurt.
君は感情を害しはせぬか
Do you not feel hurt?―Are you not hurt?
時日がたつに従って彼の感情も和らいだ
His wounded pride healed―He relented―with the lapse of time.
人の感情を重んぜよ
Have a regard for other's feelings!
彼は人の感情を重んぜぬ―(感情を害することを言う)がみがみ言う
He has no regard for others' feelings―He talks brutally.
人の感情を察する
to consult one's feelings
人の感情をくみ取る
to enter into one's feelings
老人には若い者の感情がくみ取れぬことがある
The old can not always enter into the feelings of the young.
感情に訴える
to appeal to one's feelings
人の感情を動かす
to work upon one's feelings
感情に走る
to give way to one's feelings
感情に流れる
to be emotional―sentimental
彼の文章は感情に流れる
His writings run to sentiment.
女は感情にもろい
Woman is emotional―sentimental.
感情を漏らす
to give vent to one's feelings
感情にまかせる
to give a loose to one's feelings
一時の感情に駆られる
to be carried away by a sudden impulse
一時の感情に駆られてしたことだ
He did it on the impulse of the moment.
感情を押さえる
to control one's feelings―stifle one's feelings
感情を殺す
to stifle one's feelings―suppress one's feelings
感情が高まる
One becomes excited.
感情の衝突
a jar of feelings―a collision of sentiments
二人の間に感情の衝突があったらしい
There seems to have been some jar between them.
我々の感情が食い違ったこともある
A collision of sentiment sometimes came between us.
人は感情の動物だ
Man is an emotional animal.
感情家
an emotional―a sentimentalist

かんじょう〔感状〕
〈名〉A letter of approbation (given by a general to a man who has distinguished himself on the field of battle)

content:
がんじょう〔頑丈〕
〈形〉Strong; solid; stout; substantial; massive

content.content: 頑丈な城壁
massive walls
頑丈な体格の人だ
He is a man of solid build―a man of stout build―a man of substantial build.
田舎の家は頑丈にできている
Houses are strongly built―substantially built―in the country.

かんしょうか〔観掌家〕
〈名〉A palmist; a chiromancer

かんしょうが〔乾生姜〕
〈名〉Dried ginger

かんじょうか〔感情家〕
〈名〉An emotional; a sentimentalist

かんじょうがき〔勘定書〕
〈名〉A bill; an account

かんじょうかた〔勘定方〕
〈名〉An accountant

かんしょうき〔緩衝器〕
〈名〉A buffer

かんしょうこく〔緩衝国〕
〈名〉A buffer-state

かんしょうじゅつ〔観掌術〕
〈名〉Palmistry; chiromancy

content:
かんじょうだかい〔勘定高い〕
〈形〉(To be) exact in one's accounts, exact in claiming one's due, miserly, stingy

content.content: 西洋人は勘定高い
Foreigners stand upon their rights―will have their money's worth.

かんじょうちがい〔勘定違い〕
〈名〉A mistake in calculation; an error in calculation; a miscalculation:(=する) to miscalculate; to make a mistake in calculation; to commit an error in calculation

content:
かんしょうてき〔感傷的〕
〈形〉Sentimental

content.content: 彼は娘子のように感傷的で小説を読んで泣いている
He is as sentimental as a girl, and cries over a novel.

かんじょうとり〔勘定取り〕
〈名〉A bill-collector

かんしょく〔寒色〕
〈名〉A cold colour

content:
かんしょく〔官職〕
〈名〉A government post; an official post; an office

content.content: 官職に就く
to take office
官職を辞す
to resign one's office―resign one's post―leave office

content:
かんしょく〔感触〕
〈名〉
1. (=感覚)sensation
2. (=感情)one's feelings

content.content: 感触を悪くする
(人のなら)to hurt one's feelings―(自分のなら)―feel hurt
感触が悪い
I feel badly.

かんしょく〔間色〕
〈名〉A compound colour; a secondary colour

content:
かんしょく〔間食〕
〈名〉Eating between meals:(=する) to eat between meals

content.content: 僕は間食をしない主義だ
I make it a rule never to eat between meals.

かんしょく〔閑職〕
〈名〉An easy office; a sinecure

content:
がんしょく〔顔色〕
〈名〉Countenance; look

content.content: 晴々した顔色
a bright look
鬱々した顔色
a gloomy look
君は顔色が悪い
You look sallow.
顔色が変わる
One's countenance changes―(というよりも普通は)―A change comes over one's countenance.
彼は顔色を変えた、顔色を失った
He changed colour―turned pale.
驚いて顔色を変えた
He changed colour in alarm.
顔色を変えてやって来た
He came to me in alarm.
彼はその電報を見た時は顔色が無かった
He changed colour when he read the telegram.
顔色無からしむ
to outshine the others―eclipse the others―efface the others―extinguish the others―take the shine out of the others―throw the others into the shade
彼いでて我々顔色無しだ
He has outshone us―eclipsed us―effaced us―extinguished us―throw us into the shade.
僕の成功などは君の成功に比ぶれば顔色無しだ
My success pales beside yours.
人の顔色を窺う
to hang on one's smiles

content:
かんしん〔寒心〕
〈名〉Shudder:(=する) to shudder (at the idea):(=せしむ) to make (one) shudder; to give (one) the shivers; to curdle one's blood; to make one's blood run cold

content.content: どうなるかと思うと寒心の至りである
It makes me shudder to think how this will end.
すんでのことにこの崖から落ちかけたことを思えば寒心に堪えぬ
It curdles my blood―makes my blood run cold―to think that I came near falling over this precipices.
恐ろしい人殺しの話を聞いて寒心した
The tale of a horrible murder gave me the shivers.
寒心すべき恐ろしい話
a gruesome tale
物価騰貴は寒心に堪えぬ
The appreciation of prices fills me with apprehensions.

content:
かんしん〔感心〕
〈名〉
1. Admiration; wonder:(=な) admirable (conduct); wonderful (perseverance); praiseworthy (diligence); commendable (thrift); laudable (economy); creditable (performance):(=する) to admire (one's conduct); to wonder at (one's perseverance):(=に) admirably; to admiration; creditably; with credit; to one's credit

content.content: 君の元気には実に感心する
I wonder at your energy―I admire you for your energy.
彼の忍耐にはほとほと感心する
I wonder at his perseverance―I am filled with admiration for his perseverance.
この詩にはすっかり感心してしまった
This poem has filled me with admiration.
彼の妙技には皆感心した
His wonderful performance won him universal admiration.
彼は感心に成功した
He has succeeded to admiration.
彼が演説すると皆感心して聴く
He is listened to with admiration.
感心して眺めている
They look on admiringly.
感心な人だ
He is a wonderful man.
感心な精力だ
He has wonderful energy.
好くできた、感心だ
You have done very well. It does you credit.
感心な手際だ
It is a creditable performance.
お手際感心
Your performance does you credit―You have acquitted yourself to your credit―You have acquitted yourself with credit.
あの人は感心なことには決して人の悪口を言わない
It is to his credit that he never speaks ill of others.
彼は借金をしないのは感心だ
It is to his credit that he manages to keep out of debt―Credit is due to him for keeping out of debt.
あの人は教師としてはあまり感心しない
I do not think much of him as a teacher―I have no opinion of him as a teacher.
あまり感心した文章でない
I can't say much for his style.
支那料理はあまり感心しない
I don't care much for Chinese food.

content:
かんしん〔歓心〕
〈名〉Favour

content.content: 歓心を買う
to seek one's favour―win one's favour―ingratiate oneself with another―insinuate oneself into another's good graces―worm oneself into another's good graces
彼は主人の歓心を買うために非常に勉強した
He worked very hard to win his master's favour.
彼は上手に人の歓心を買う
He will ingratiate himself with you―insinuate himself into your good graces―worm himself into your good graces.
人に媚びて歓心を買う
to curry favour with one

content:
かんしん〔関心〕
〈名〉Interest; concern:(=する) to be interested (in something); to be concerned (with something)

content.content: 僕は政治には関心せぬ
I am not interested in politics―not concerned with politics―indifferent to politics.
無関心
unconcern

content:
かんしん〔奸臣〕
〈名〉A wicked courtier; an evil counsellor; a treacherous subject; a traitor; an intriguer

content.content: 奸臣はびこる
Intrigue is rampant.
奸臣を斬る
to slay the traitor
奸臣をしりぞける
to clear the Court of corrupt elements

content:
かんじん〔勧進〕
〈名〉Soliciting contributions for religious purposes:(=する) to solicit contributions for pious purposes

content.content: 勧進帳
a subscription-book

content:
かんじん〔寛仁〕
〈形〉Generous; liberal; charitable; merciful; clement

content.content: 寛仁大度な人だ
He is a man of generous and magnanimous disposition.

content:
かんじん〔肝心〕
〈形〉Essential (to something); vital (to something); of vital importance; all-important

content.content: 幸福には健康が肝心だ
Health is essential to happiness.
成功するには辛抱が肝心だ
Perseverance is essential to success.
この事を成就するには絶対秘密が肝心だ
Absolute secrecy is vital to the success of the scheme.
そこが肝心なところだ
That is the vital point―a point of vital importance.
肝心な結論を聞き落とした
I did not hear the all-important conclusion.
語学には熟練がいちばん肝心だ
In language-study, practice is the main thing―the great thing.
この縁談は皆賛成だが肝心の本人が不承知だ
Everybody approves of the match, all but the party concerned herself, who objects to it.
肝心の玉がいない
“The bird is flown.”
人間あきらめが肝心
Resignation is the great lesson of life.

かんじん〔閑人〕
〈名〉A man of leisure; an idler

かんじん〔奸人〕
〈名〉A knave; a villain

content:
かんじんかなめの〔肝心要めの〕
〈形〉The most important; all-important

content.content: 肝心要の結論を聞き落とした
I failed to hear the all-important conclusion.

がんしんけい〔眼神経〕
〈名〉The optic nerve

content:
かんじんたいど〔寛仁大度〕
〈形〉Generous and magnanimous

content.content: 寛仁大度な人だ
He is a man of generous and magnanimous disposition.

かんじんちょう〔勧進帳〕
〈名〉A subscription-book

かんじんもと〔勧進元〕
〈名〉The promoter of wrestling matches

content:
かんじんより〔紙裂縒〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: かんぜより〔観世縒〕

かんすい〔鹹水〕
〈名〉Sea-water; salt-water; brine

かんすいせき〔寒水石〕
〈名〉Calcarious spar; a kind of marble

かんすいよく〔灌水浴〕
〈名〉A shower-bath

かんすう〔完数〕
〈名〉［数学］An integer

かんすう〔函数〕
〈名〉［数学］A function

content:
かんする〔冠する〕
〈他動〉To crown (a king)

content.content: 雪を冠する
to be capped with snow
富士は千古の雪を冠す
Mr. Fuji is capped with eternal snow.
雪を冠せる山
a snow-capt mountain―snow-capt heights
名を冠する
to call one something
世人 Carlyle に冠するに Chelsea の哲人の名をもってせり
Carlyle was called the Philosopher of Chelsea.

content:
かんする〔姦する〕
〈他動〉To debauch, seduce, violate, outrage (a woman)

content.content: 処女を姦する
to deflower a maiden

かんする〔管する〕
〈他動〉To control (affairs)

content:
かんする〔関する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=関係する)to relate to, refer to (a matter); to pertain to, appertain to (a subject); to regard, respect, concern, touch (anything); to bear upon (a matter)

content.content: 財産に関する法律
laws relating to property―laws referring to property
道徳に関する問題
questions pertaining to morality―questions appertaining to morality
僕に関したことではない
The matter does not concern me―It is no concern of mine.

content: 《a》(=何々に)関して→『

content.content: かんして〔関して〕

content:
』
《b》(=何々に)関せず→『

content.content: かかわらず〔拘わらず〕
かんせず〔関せず〕
我関せず焉だ
I don't care―That's no concern of mine.
彼は関せず焉と澄ましている
He looks quite unconcerned.

content: 2. (=係わる)to concern (one's honour); to involve (one's safety); to affect (one's prosperity); to endanger (one's life); to imperil (one's reputation); to compromise (one's honour)

content.content: 人命に関する
to endanger life
生命に関する
to endanger one's life―(病)―a fatal disease―(傷)―a mortal wound
この病は生命に関することがある
This disease sometimes proves fatal.
この病は生命には関せぬ
This disease is not fatal.
この傷は生命に関するかも知れぬ
The wound may prove mortal.
この傷は生命には関せぬ
The wound is not mortal.
これは僕の生命に関する大事件だ
It is a matter of life and death to me.
生命に関する問題だ
It is a hanging matter.
これは僕の一身上に関することだ
The matter concerns my welfare―The matter concerns me nearly―The matter touches me nearly―The matter lies near my heart―It is a near concern.
名誉に関することだ
The matter concerns my honour―My honour is concerned―My honour is at stake.
名誉に関するから弁明しておかねばならぬ
I must clear myself, for my honour is at stake.
名誉に関することはせぬ(李下に冠を正さず)
I will not compromise my honour.
君はあんなことを聞き捨てにすると名誉に関するぞ
If you pass over such a remark in silence, it will imperil your reputation―your reputation will suffer.
これは国家の安危に関する問題だ
The matter involves the safety of the State―concerns the welfare of the State.
それは国家の威信に関する問題だ
The matter involves the national prestige―The national prestige is involved in the matter.
それは家の繁栄に関することだ
The matter affects the prosperity of the house.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: そんなことをしては国家の体面に関する
Such conduct will reflect on your country.
そんなことをしては君の人格に関する
Such conduct will derogate from your character―Such conduct would be derogatory to your character.
そんなことをしては紳士の品格に関する
It would be beneath the dignity of a gentleman―beneath a gentleman―to do such a thing.
今度こそは信用に関するからぜひ成功せにゃならぬ
I am bound to succeed this time, or I should lose credit with people.

content:
かんする〔燗する〕
〈他動〉To warm (sake)

content.content: 酒を燗して飲む、燗せずして飲む
to drink sake hot―drink sake cold

content:
かんする〔緘する〕
〈他動〉To seal (a letter)

content.content: 口を緘して言わず
He firmly shut his mouth.

content:
かんずる〔感ずる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=人が感ずる)to feel (pain); to experience (inconvenience); to find (difficulty); to be sensible (to shame ―of kindness)

content.content: 胸部に痛みを感ずる
I feel a pain in the chest.
暑さや寒さを感ずる
to feel the heat or cold
彼は暑い寒いを感ぜぬ
He is insensible to heat or cold.
百度の暑気も風があるとさほどに感ぜぬ
We do not much feel the heat at 100° if there is a breeze.
空腹を感ずる
I feel hungry.
ひどく空腹を感じてきた
Hunger began to make itself felt.
田舎にいると不便を感ずる
I experience inconvenience in the country.
痛切に不便を感ずる
The inconvenience is keenly felt.
不便を感ぜしむ
to inconvenience one―incommode one―discommode me
道が遠くて不便を感ずる
The distance inconveniences me.
必要を感ずる
to feel a need
良い辞書の必要が痛切に感じられる
The need of a good dictionary is keenly felt.
欠乏を感ずる
to feel a want―miss anything
そういう学校の欠乏を痛切に感ずる
The want of such a school is keenly felt.
慣れない人は演説をするに困難を感ずる
Those who are not accustomed to it find difficulty―experience difficulty―in speaking in public.
恩に感ずる、恩に感ぜぬ
to be sensible of kindness―be insensible to kindness
ご恩には深く感じております
I am deeply sensible of your favours.
彼はいくら親切を尽しても感じない
Kindness is thrown away upon him.
いくら意見をしても感じない
All my words are wasted upon him.
感じやすい
sensitive

content: 2. (=物が人に感ずる)to affect (one); to have effect on (one)

content.content: 酒を飲んでも僕に感じない
Wine does not affect me―Wine has no effect on me.
いくら意見をしても彼に感じない
All my words had no effect on him.
あの人の言うことは僕の神経に感ずる
His words affect my nerves.

content: 3. (=感動する)to be impressed with (anything); to be struck with (anything); to be affected, be moved, be touched (by some sight or story)

content.content: 僕は系統的研究の必要を深く感じている
I am deeply impressed with the importance of systematic study.
彼は無常を感じて世を捨てた
He was impressed with the mutability of human affairs, and renounced the world.

〈名〉A chat:(=する) to chat with, have a chat with (a chum)

We chatted the time away.
閑談時の移るを知らず
We took no note of time while chatting.

content:
がんたん〔元旦〕
〈名〉The New Year's Day

content.content: 一年の計は元旦にあり
The New Year's Day is the key of the year―(に相当するは)―“The first hour of the morning is the key of the day.”

〈名〉A thermometer:(普通の談話には)the mercury

content.content: 今日は寒暖計は何度か
What does the thermometer register today?―How is the mercury today?
寒暖計は九十度を示す
The mercury stands at 90°―The mercury registers 90°―The mercury indicates 90°―The mercury records 90°(ninety degrees).
寒暖計が上がる、寒暖計が下がる
The mercury rises―The mercury falls.
寒暖計が百度に上がる
The mercury rises to 100°
寒暖計が氷点まで下がる
The mercury falls to the freezing-point.

摂氏寒暖計
the centigrade thermometer
列氏寒暖計

最高寒暖計、最低寒暖計

content:

content.content: 彼は間断無く働いている
He is constantly at work―He is continually at work―He is incessantly at work―He labours without intermission.
あの女は間断無くしゃべっている
She is constantly talking―She is talking incessantly―She talks without cessation―She talks nineteen to the dozen.
あの家には朝から晩まで入りかわりたちかわり間断無く来客がある
They have a constant succession of company―an unceasing stream of visitors―from morning till night.

content: 3. (=閑職)a sinecure

2. (=意味を含むこと) implication:(=する) to imply (some meaning)

content.content: 含蓄構文
pregnant construction

a pregnant verb

content:
がんちゅう〔眼中〕
〈副〉In one's eyes

content.content: 眼中に置く
to take anything into consideration―take anything into account―take account of anything
眼中に置かぬ
to take no account of anything―leave anything out of account―leave anything out of consideration―disregard―ignore―defy―set anything at defiance―set anything at naught
人の身分などは眼中に置かぬ
I take no account of rank.
彼は物の値段などは眼中に置かぬ
He leaves the prices out of account.
前置詞を眼中に置かなかったのが悪い
They ought not to have left the prepositions out of consideration.
彼らは眼中法律無し
They defy the law―set the law at defiance.
眼中政府無し
They set the government at naught.
この事実を眼中に置かなかったのが間違いだ
They ought not to have ignored this fact.
彼の眼中礼儀も作法もない
He disregards all rules of propriety.
あんな奴らは眼中に置かぬ
Such men are beneath my notice.
報酬などは眼中に置かぬ
Emolument is no object with me.
天下英雄有眼中
The great ones of the land are nothing in my eyes.

content:
かんつう〔貫通〕
〈名〉Penetration; perforation:(=する) to penetrate (the armour); to perforate (a plate); to pierce (a part of the body); to pass through (the wall); to run through (a peninsula); to shoot through (the heart, etc.)

content.content: 砲弾が甲鉄を貫通する
A shell penetrates the armour―pierces the armour―passes through the armour.
鉄坂を貫通する
to pierce a steel plate―perforate a steel plate
銃弾が心臓を貫通した
He was shot through the heart.
貫通銃創
a piercing wound
彼は青島で右の腕に貫通銃創を受けた
He was shot through the right arm at Tsintau.
鉄道が半島を貫通している
A railway runs through the peninsula.
その地方は鉄道が縦横に貫通している
The region is a network of railways.
中央線はいつ貫通するか
When is the Central Line to be completed?

content:
かんづく〔勘付く〕
〈自他動〉To suspect, be suspicious of (treachery); to smoke (fool play); to scent (a plot); to sniff (danger); to get wind of (an affair); to smell a rat

content.content: 二人の仲を主人に勘づかれた
Their relation were suspected by their master.
相手が裏切りをせぬかと勘づいた
I smoked treachery―I suspected treachery―I was suspicious of treachery.
その男は勘づいて逐電した
The man got wind of the affair, and absconded.
こいつあやしいなと勘づいた
I smelled a rat.
勘づかれないように別々に行った
We went each by himself to disarm suspicion.

content:

content.content: イワシの缶詰

ハムの缶詰
potted ham

content:
かんてい〔鑑定〕
〈名〉Judgment; an expert opinion; a professional opinion; professional advice; appraisal (of value):(法廷にては)expert evidence:(=する) to judge (art); to be a judge of (swords); to be a connoisseur of (painting); to give one's opinion; to pronounce (the article genuine or false); to appraise (the value)

content.content: 鑑定をつける、鑑定がつく
to form a judgment
金剛石を玉屋に見せると本物(偽物)と鑑定した
The jeweller pronounced the diamond genuine―pronounced it false.
彼の鑑定ではこの刀は真正の正宗だ
He has pronounced the sword a genuine Masamune.
彼は刀剣の鑑定をする
He is a judge of swords―a connoisseur of swords.
彼は書画の鑑定をする
He is a judge of paintings―a connoisseur of paintings.
書画の鑑定
a professional opinion on paintings
書画を鑑定する
to give a professional opinion on a painting
鑑定違いをした
I have misjudged.
弁護士の鑑定を乞う
to consult a lawyer―take legal advice―take advice
専門家の鑑定を乞う
to consult an expert―ask for an expert opinion
価格を鑑定する
to appraise the value
鑑定価格

鑑定家、鑑定人
(美術なら)a judge of art―a connoisseur―a virtuoso―(原稿なら)―a reader―a taster―(法廷にては)―an expert witness
(法廷の)鑑定人

鑑定人の証言

(鑑定人が)筆跡を鑑定する

鑑定料

I was deeply impressed by his speech.

〈名〉
1. Superintendence; supervision; oversight; control; charge; care:(=する) to superintend (the compilation); to supervise (the works); to oversee (the workmen); to control (the finances); to take charge of, have charge of (an office); to take care of (the furniture); to look after (a school); to attend to (an engine, etc.)

content.content: 工事は技師が監督している

子どもの監督をする婦人が入用だ

普請は自分が監督した

議会は財政を監督する

議会の主要なる機能は財政の監督と法案の審議とにあり
The chief functions of the Diet are to control the finances and to deliberate on legislative measures.
道具は僕が監督をする

試験の監督をする

a factory-inspector

content:
かんなん〔艱難〕
〈名〉Hardships; privations; difficulties; adversity

content.content: 艱難をなめる
to go through hardships―undergo hardships―see hardships―suffer privations
ずいぶん艱難を経て来た人だ
He has gone through many hardship―gone through much.
艱難に堪える、艱難を忍ぶ
to endure hardships―bear one's cross
艱難と戦う
to struggle with adversity―contend with difficulties
艱難汝を玉にす
“Adversity makes a man wise.”
艱難に居て友を知る
Adversity tries friends.

content:
かんなんしんく〔艱難辛苦〕
〈名〉Hardships and privations; difficulties; adversity:(=する) to see hardships; to suffer privations; to struggle with adversity; to contend with difficulties; to rough it

content.content: 艱難辛苦を経る
to go through hardships―undergo hardships―see hardships
なかなか艱難辛苦を経て来た人だ
He has gone through many hardships―gone through much.

to endure hardships―bear one's cross

content:

〈名〉Patience; forbearance; forgiveness:(=する) to forbear; to bear with (one); to be patient with (one); to have patience with (one); to forgive (one for a fault); to spare (one pain)

content.content: 堪忍してくれ
Bear with me!―Be patient with me!―Have patience with me!
あの男は堪忍ができん
I have no patience with him―I am out of patience with him.
堪忍袋の緒が切れた

弱い者は堪忍してやれ
Show forbearance towards the weak!
今度だけは堪忍してやる

恥をかかせることだけは堪忍してくれ給え
You will spare me the shame.
ならぬ堪忍するが堪忍
To forbear when you can not forbear, is truly to forbear.

content:

content.content: 門にカンヌキを掛ける

content:

1. (=意象)an idea; a notion; a conception

content.content: 抽象的観念

content.content: 土人は義務観念が無い

content.content: しかたがないと観念している
I am resigned to the necessity―I submit to necessity―I abide by the inevitable.
人生のはかなさを観念する

お前はしょせん助からぬ、観念せい
Nothing can save you. Resign yourself to your fate!
彼は死を観念している
He is resigned to death.
あの時はとても助からぬものと観念しておった
I gave myself up for lost.
人生は善かれ悪しかれこんなものだと観念した
I take life for better or for worse.

content: 《a》(気が)

Do you feel like trying?―Do you feel inclined to try?―Are you disposed to try?―Are you minded to try?―Have you a mind to try?

I feel that it is true.
不安心な気がする
I feel uneasy.

I remember meeting him somewhere.

Do you fancy anything today?

She is setting her cap at you.

彼女は悲しくて気が気でないのだ
She is beside herself with grief.
あの人は気が好い
He is good-natured.
気が大きい
to be generous―magnanimous
彼はケチどころか気が大き過ぎる
So far from being a miser, he is generous to a fault.
気が小さい
to be timid―pusillanimous―chicken-hearted
気が狭い
to be narrow-minded
気が強い
to be spirited―plucky―stout-hearted
気が弱い
to be timorous―nervous―weak-hearted―faint-hearted
気が早い
to be easily excited―excitable
江戸っ子は気が早い
The Edokko are excitable.
気が短い
to be short-tempered
関東者は気が短い
The Kanto people are short-tempered.
気が長い
to be deliberate―patient
京都者は気が長い
The Kyoto people are deliberate.
気が荒い
to be of a violent temper―of a fierce disposition
九州人は気が荒い
The Kyushu people are of a fierce disposition.
男は気が多い
Men are fickle―inconstant.
貴方は気が多いのね
You have a ranging fancy.
気が軽い
to be light of heart―light-hearted―gay―cheerful
気が重い
to be heavy-hearted―lazy―sluggish―phlegmatic
気がさくい
to be open-hearted―frank
気が利く
to have judgment―have good sense―have strong sense―have a head on one's shoulders
あの男はなかなか気が利く
He has a head on his shoulders―He is a knowing fellow―He knows a thing or two.
あの女中は山出しにしては気が利いている
She is smart for a girl fresh from the mountains.
気が利かない
to be awkward―to have no head
気が利かないね
How awkward you are!
彼は判断力に乏しい、俗にいう気が利かないのだ
He is wanting judgment. He has, in common parlance, no head.
あの女は支度が気が利いている、支度が気が利かない
She dresses in good taste―dresses in bad taste.
支度が立派過ぎて気が利かない
Her dress is too rich for good taste.
はたの者が気が利かない
The others are slow to take the hint.
気が向く
to be in the humour―in the mood―in the vein―for doing anything
彼は気が向くとよく働く
He will work hard when he is in the humour.
今日は気が向かないから勉強するのはいやだ
I am in no mood for working today.
気が合う
to agree in temper―agree in disposition
彼と気が合う
I agree very well with him―We agree very well together―We are in sympathy with each other―We are congenial spirits.
夫婦は気があっている
The couple are happy together―They hit it off together―They hit it off with each other.
気が違う、気が狂う

君はそんなことをして気が違ったのでないか
Are you mad―possessed―that you should attempt such a thing?
君は気が違いはせぬかと思った
I feared for your reason.
気がふれている
He is touched―cracked―crack-brained―not right in his head―not right in his mind―wrong in the upper story―off his head―unsound in mind―out of his mind―out of his wits―out of his senses.
気が変になった
His wits are wandering―His reason wanders.
彼はあまり嬉しがって気が変になった
Excessive joy has turned his head.
彼女はあまり悲しがって気が変になった
Excessive grief has turned her brain.
まだ気が確かだ
I am still sound in mind―of sound mind―in my right mind.
気がもめる
I am fretting myself―worrying myself―in suspense―I hang in suspense―I sit on thorns.
気が引ける
I feel small―feel mean―feel cheap.
思うと気が引ける
It is humiliating to think of it.
気がつく
to notice―remark―perceive―become aware of anything―(正気がつくの意味なら)―come to (oneself)
主婦は万事に気がつく
The mistress remarks everything.
よく気がつく(気がまわる)人だ
He is quick to notice everything―He is quick of perception―He is quick in anticipating your wishes.
大勢居たからその人に気がつかなかった
I did not notice him in the crowd.
(汽車を乗り違えて)一時間程たってから漸く気がついた
It was an hour before I became aware of my mistake.
気がついて見ると見慣れないところに寝て居った
When I came to myself, I found myself lying in a strange place.
好いところに気がついた
Well said!
気が立つ
to be excited
気が立っているからすぐけんかする
Excited people are ready to quarrel.
気が張っている
One's mind is on the stretch―One's senses are on the strain.
忙しいと気が張っている
Press of business Keeps one's mind on the stretch.
気が張っていると病気にならない
Tension of mind keeps one from falling ill.
気がふさぐ、気が欝する
to feel gloomy―to be depressed in spirits
今日は気がふさぐ日だ
The weather is depressing today.
気が晴れる
to feel cheerful
散歩すると気が晴れる
A walk will dispel your gloom.
気が浮く
to be gay―light-hearted
気が沈む
to be grave―heavy-hearted―depressed in spirits―in low spirits
気がとがめる
to go against one's conscience
気がとがめてそんなことはできまい
It must go against his conscience to do such a thing―He must have qualms of conscience about doing such a thing.
気がすむ
to be satisfied―be appeased
(これをして)まず気がすんだ
My heart is satisfied―My conscience is appeased.
金を返して気がすんだ
The payment of the money has appeased my conscience.
医者に見て貰わないと気がすまない
I make a conscience of consulting my doctor.
借金を返さないと気がすまない
I make a point of paying my debts.
悪いことをして気がすまない
I have a sin on my conscience―I feel remorse for a crime.
気がまぎれる
to be diverted from care
人と話しをすると気がまぎれて苦労を忘れる
Talk diverts my mind from care.
気が散る
The attention is distracted.
騒がしいと気が散る
Noise distracts the attention.
気がゆるむ
One's attention is relaxed.
試験がすんで気がゆるんだ
The conclusion of the examination has relaxed my mind.
気が開ける
to feel relieved―feel relief
気が進む
to be eager―willing―forward―to do something
気が進まぬ
to be reluctant―unwilling―backward―to do anything
気が変わる
to change one's mind
お気が変らないうちに頂戴しておきましょう
I shall trouble you for it before you change your mind.
よく気の変わる人だ
He is a man of moods.
気があせる、気がせく
to be impatient
早く行きたくて気がせいている
I am impatient to be gone.
気がせいてじっとしていられぬ
I feel restless.
気がつまる
to feel constrained―feel oppressed
皆黙っていると気がつまる
Silence is oppressive.
あの人の前へ出ると気がつまる
His presence is oppressive.
座敷は気がつまるから逃げて来た
I have escaped from the oppressive atmosphere of the parlour.
あの人は気が置けない
You feel at home with him.
今日は気が引立たない
I feel dull―feel languid―feel depressed―feel out of sorts―to day.
あの少年は気が勝っている
He is a lad of spirit.
彼は気が迷っているのだ
He is in doubt how to act.
話に気が乗る
to warm up to one's subject
仕事に気が乗る
to warm to one's work
仕事に気が乗らぬ
I have no heart for my work.
気が落付かぬ
to be in a fidget―to have the fidgets
気が遠くなる
to feel faint
気が重い
to be sluggish―phlegmatic
あまり静かだと気が重くなる
Silence oppresses my spirits―weighs on my spirits.
気がはずむ
to be spurred on
とんとん拍子に行ったので気がはずんだ
Easy successes spurred me on.
気がくじける
to be daunted
気が練れている
He is well schooled―He has a schooled mind.
その報に接して気が動転した
The news upset me.
気が腐る
to be dispirited―be discouraged―be disheartened―be dejected
あんなことをする気が知れぬ
Why he should have done such a thing, is more than I can tell―above my comprehension.
あんな者を女房にする気が知れぬ
There is no accounting for tastes.

content: 《b》(気に)

content.content: 気に入る、気にかなう、気に合う

to please one―suit one―suit one's fancy―take one's fancy―find favour with one―recommend itself to―one―(形容詞に訳せば)―to be satisfactory to one―agreeable to one―acceptable to one―(熟語に訳せば)―to be to one's taste―to one's liking―to one's mind―after one's heart―after one's fancy
この品はどれもお気に入りませんか
Do none of these articles suit you?
どれも気に入らぬ
None of them suit me.
気に入った品が無い
I can't find an article to my taste―after my fancy.
やっと気にかなった家がありました
At last I have found a house to my liking―after my fancy.
あれは実に気に入った男だ
He is a man after my own heart.
どうですか今度のお宅はお気に入りましたか
Is your new house to your liking?―How do you like your new house?
たいそう気に入りました
I am very much pleased with it.
ことにその位置が気に入りました
I am especially pleased at its situation.
どうですか今度の学校はお気に入りましたか
How do you like your new school?
仕事が気に入った
The work is to my taste.
この縁談は気に入らぬ
The match is not to my liking―I do not like the match.
気に入らないことがあるから仕事を止めた
I gave up the work, for I found something disagreeable.
条件が気に入らなかった
The terms were not satisfactory―unsatisfactory.
この絵が気に入った
This picture has taken my fancy―I have taken a fancy to this picture.
彼は主人に気に入った
He found favour with his master―found favour in the eyes of his master.
主人に気に入っている
He is in favour with his master―a favourite with his master―in his master's good graces.
たいそう主人に気に入っている
He is in high favour with his master―a great favourite with his master.
どうして主人の気に入ったか
How did he get into favour with his master?―(他動詞構文にすれば)―What made him a favourite with his master?
正直なために主人のお気に入った
His honesty made him a favourite with his master.
この子は伯(叔)父さんのお気に入りです
The boy is a favourite with his uncle.
お気に入りの子
a favourite child
誰でも正直にすれば主人の気に入る
Honesty will make any one a favourite with his master-Honesty will recommend any one to his master.
彼は正直だから気に入った
I am pleased at his honesty―His honesty recommends him to me―He has recommended himself to me by his honesty.
僕の気に入ったのはその方法の安全なことだ
I am pleased at the safety of the method―The safety of the method recommends itself to me.
あの男には何をさせても気に入らぬ
He can not do anything to my satisfaction.
人に物をさせて気に入らぬなら自分でするがよい
If you can not have anything done to your satisfaction, you had better do it yourself.
私でお気に入るかどうか
I wonder if I can give you satisfaction.
気に懸かる、気になる
to weigh on one's mind―lie at one's heart―get on one's nerves
この借金が気に懸かる
This debt weighs on my mind―This debt is a weight on my mind.
彼の安危が気に懸かる
His safety lies at my heart.
あの男が気になる
He is getting on my nerves.
あのことが気になる
The matter weighs on my mind―I feel uneasy about the matter.
彼に言われたことが気になる
His words rankle in my breast.
気に懸ける、気に病む、気にする
to mind anything―take anything to heart―take on
そう気にするな
Don't take on so!
彼の言うことを気にし給うな
Never mind what he says!
彼は失散をひどく気にしている
He takes his failure seriously to heart―He is sore on the subject of his failure.
僕は失敗などを気にしない
I take my failure quite easy.
世評を気にしては何事もできぬ
One who is sensitive to criticism, can do nothing.
気にせぬ
I take my failure easy―make nothing of troubles―care nothing for dangers.
君はそんなうまいことを言うと僕はその気になるよ
I will take you at your word.
どうしてこんな仕事を引受ける気になったか
What induced you to undertake the work?―What put it in your head to undertake such work?
何と思ったか引受ける気になった
I took it into my head to undertake it.
条件が好いから引受ける気になった
The good terms induced me to undertake it.
この仕事はどうしても引受ける気になれぬ
I can not bring myself to undertake the work.
子どもが好い気になる
A child is spoilt.
君は子どもをあまり大事にするから好い気になるのだ
You spoil your children by making too much of them.
気にさわる
to offend one―give offence
彼は何か気にさわったとみえて怒っている
He is offended at something.
どうしてお気にさわったかさらに合点がいかぬ
I am at a loss to comprehend how I can have offended him.
気に喰わぬ
to go against the grain―go against the stomach―(形容詞に訳せば)―to be disagreeable to one―distasteful to one―unsatisfactory to one―unacceptable to one
謝まらせられたのは気に喰わなかった
It went against my grain to apologize.
気に喰わないことを言う奴だ
He says such disagreeable things.
条件が気に喰わない
The terms are unsatisfactory (to me).
気にとめる
to give heed to anything
彼は人に悪口を言われても気にとめない
He gives no heed to people's remarks.

content: 《c》(気の)

content.content: お気の毒です
I am sorry for you.
このように不意に去るのはお気の毒ですが
I am sorry to leave you at such short notice.
お気の毒だがご依頼に応じかねます
I am sorry to say―I regret to say―that I can not comply with your request.
あの人の身の上は気の毒です
His condition is pitiable―to be pitied.
気の毒な人だ
He is a pitiable man―a pitiful man.
皆あの人を気の毒がっている
We feel sorry for him―We take pity on him―We commiserate him.
彼に気をもませるのは気の毒だ
It is cruel to keep him in suspense.
彼は気の毒なほど気がねする
He is afraid of giving trouble to a painful extent.
気の毒なほど行儀をくずさない
He is painfully proper.
あれは気の利いた男だ
He is a sensible man―a smart man―a knowing fellow.
気の利いたふうをしている
He has a smart air.
気の利いたことを言う
He says sensible things.
あの女は気の利いた支度をする、気の利いかぬ支度をする
She dresses in good taste―dresses in bad taste.
この辺には気の利いた料理屋が無い
There are no respectable restaurants in this neighbourhood.
気の利いた化け物の引込む時分だ
It is time a respectable ghost should leave the earth.
気の利かない男だ
He has no head―He is an awkward man―an ungainly person―a clumsy figure―a gawk.
気の大きい人だ
He is a generous man―a magnanimous man.
気の小さい人だ
He is a timid man―a pusillanimous man―a chicken-hearted man.
気の好い人だ
He is a good-natured man.
気の短い男だ
He is short-tempered―quick-tempered.
気の長い人だ
He is a deliberate man―a patient man.
気の強い犬だ
It is a spirited dog.
気の勝った小僧だ
He is a lad of spirit.
気の弱い女(はびっくりする)
A timorous woman―A nervous woman―would be frightened.
気のまわる男だ
He is a smart fellow―a quick-witted fellow.
気の多い人だ
He is fickle―inconstant―He has a ranging fancy.
彼は気の引立たない性質だ、気の重い質だ
He is of a dull disposition―of a phlegmatic temperament.
二人は気の合った同志だ
They are congenial spirits.
気の変りやすい人だ
He is a flighty man―a volatile man―a man of moods.
気のせい
fancy
気のせいか知らないが君は急に背が延びたようだ
It may be fancy, but you seem to have shot up all of a sudden.
気の持ちよう
one's way of thinking―the temper of one's mind
幸不幸は貧富よりも気の持ちようだ
Happiness depends, not so much on circumstances, as on one's way of thinking.
気の持ちようで貧乏も辛くない
A good temper of mind will disarm poverty of its sting.

content: 《d》(気を)

content.content: 気を付ける
to take care of anything―be careful of anything―give attention to details―pay attention to a lecture―note a fact―take note of a fact―mind one's business
身体に気をつけなさい
Be careful of your health!
風邪を引かぬように気をつけよ
Be careful not to take cold.
あの犬に喰いつかれないように気をつけよ
Take care that the dog does not bite you.
あの人には気をつけてものを言わないと立腹する
You must be careful in speaking to him, for he is apt to take offence.
説明する時気をつけてお聴きなさい
You must pay attention to me when I explain.
気をつけてご覧なさい
Note well!
言語挙動に気をつけよ
Mind your P's and Q's!
足下に気をつけよ
Mind your footings!―(用心せよの意味なら)―Be circumspect!
(号令)気をつけー
'Tion!
気をつけの姿勢を取る
to stand at attention
気を使う
to be afraid of giving trouble
気をもむ
to fret (oneself)―worry (oneself)―bother oneself
彼は試験で気をもんでいる
He is fretting over his examination―worrying over his examination.
相場師は天気で気をもむ
A speculator bothers himself about the weather.
(否とも応とも返事が無いので)気をもんでいる
He is in suspense.
(相手がすっぱ抜きはせぬかと思って)しきりに気を揉んでいる(針のムシロに坐す心地)
He is sitting on thorns.
気をもませる
to keep one in suspense―(美人が男に気をもませるのは)―disturb one's peace of mind
(早く返事をしてやれ)気を揉ませるのは罪だ
It is cruel to keep him in suspense.
気を晴らす
to divert oneself―dispel one's gloom
気を散ずる、気をまぎらす
to dissipate care―divert one's mind from care
酒に気をまぎらす
to drown care in wine
気を張る
to strain one's attention―stretch one's senses―strain one's nerves
気を張りつめる
to strain every nerve―stretch every sense
(軍艦では水雷攻撃があると)気を張りつめているからたまらない
The strain on the nerves is more than one can bear.
気を引き締める
to brace oneself
気を配る
to be vigilant―watchful―on the watch―on the lookout
八方へ気を配って敵を警戒する
They are on the alert for the enemy.
気をゆるめる
to relax one's attention―relax one's vigilance
気を利かす
to use one's judgment―use one's head―act on one's own judgment―take the hint―have good sense―be sensible
命令を執行する時は気を利かすつもりで違ったことをしてはいけない
You must not use your own judgment in executing orders.
気を利かしてその場をはずした
I took the hint, and kept out of the way―I discreetly kept out of the way.
娘は気を利かして返事をしなかった
She was so sensible as to make no reply―She had the good sense to remain silent.
気をまわす
to suspect―be suspicious
悪い方へ気をまわす
to attach a double meaning to innocent remarks―have sinful thoughts―have a dirty mind―have an impure mind
君はすぐにいやに気をまわすぜ
You attach a strange meaning to what I say.
気を落着ける
to compose oneself―collect oneself―gather one's scattered wits
気を鎮める
to calm oneself―compose oneself
気を落とす
to lose heart―be disheartened―be discouraged
気を取り直す(心を励ます)
to take heart (of grace)
人の気を引き立てる
to cheer one up―rouse one up―stir one up
気を失う
to lose one's consciousness―fall unconscious―lose one's senses―fall senseless―fall insensible―fall into a swoon―swoon―faint
気を確かに持て
Keep a good heart!―Be of good heart!
人の気を損ずる
to hurt one's feelings
気を悪くする
to feel hurt
気を許す
to trust a man
七人の子を生んでも女に気を許すな
Do not trust a woman even if she be the mother of seven children.
気を引く
to try one's temper―(意見を叩くの意味なら)―sound one's views
気を腐らす
to be dispirited―be discouraged―be disheartened―be dejected
気で気を病む
One's heart preys on itself.
娘は気で気を病んでやせ衰えるばかりです
She is eating her heart out.

content: 2. (=香気)flavour

content.content: (ビールなど)気が抜ける
to become flat
気の抜けたビール
flat beer―dead beer―stale beer―vapid beer

content: 3. (=気体)gas:(空気) air:(水気) vapour:(蒸気) steam

き〔季〕
〈名〉A season

content.content: 四季
the four seasons

content:
き〔記〕
〈名〉An account; a narrative:(=する) to narrate (an event); to give an account of (an affair)

content.content: 海に遊ぶの記
an account of a voyage

content:
き〔騎〕
〈名〉A horseman

content.content: 百騎
a hundred horsemen―(を略して)―a hundred horse
五千騎を率いて応援す
He went to the rescue at the head of 5,000 horse.

content:
き〔生〕
〈形〉Pure (sake); neat (spirits)

content.content: 火酒を生で飲む
to drink spirits neat
灘の生一本
pure Nada wine

content:
き〔木〕
〈名〉
1. (=樹木)a tree

content.content: 山に木が生えている
Trees grow on the mountains.
木の生えた山
a wooded mountain
山は高きをもって貴からず木あるをもって貴しとす
A mountain is valuable, not because it is high, but because it is wooded.
木を植える
to plant a tree
この木は植え替えたのだ
The tree has been replanted.
通りに木が植えてある
The streets are planted with trees.
この木は水を揚げているか
Is this tree alive?
この木は枯れた
The tree is dead.
木が枯れる
A tree dies.
木を伐る
to cut down a tree―fell a tree
木を切り払う
to clear away the trees―clear the land from trees
木に花が咲く
Trees blossom.
木に実が生る
Trees bear fruit.
木の実
fruits―nuts―berries
この木はもう実が生りますか
Has this tree begun to bear?
この木はよく実が生ります
This tree is a good bearer.
梨の木に梨が生っている
There are pears on the pear-tree.
木にまだ生っている
There are more on the tree.
木で熟した蜜柑は持ちが悪い
Oranges ripened on the tree do not keep long.
辛抱する木に金が生る
“Wealth flows from industry.”
木に登る
to climb a tree
猿のように木登りする
He climbs like a monkey―They climb like so many monkeys.
彼は木に登っている
He is up in that tree.
木から落ちる
to fall out of a tree―tumble out of a tree
猿も木から落ちる
“A good marksman may miss”―“Good swimmers are oftenest drowned.”
木から落ちた猿
a fish out of water
鳥が木に巣をくう
A bird builds (its nest) in a tree.
あの木に鳥の巣がある
There is a nest up (in) that tree.
木をつぐ
to graft a tree
木に竹をついだよう
to be out of keeping with each other―incongruous
木の陰に
under the shade of a tree
木の下で休んだ
We rested ourselves under a tree―under the shade of a tree.
(僕にそんなことを尋ねるのは)木によって魚を求めるも同然だ
You might as well go to a tree for fish.
木の幹
the trunk of a tree
木の枝
(大きいのは)the boughs of a tree―(小さいのは)―the branches of a tree
木の皮
the bark of a tree
木の心
the heart of a tree
木の切株
the stump of a tree
木の又
a fork of a tree
木の又からでも生れしゃんしたか
Are you not made of flesh and blood?

content: 2. (=木材)Wood:(建築用のは)timber:(運搬中のは)lumber

content.content: 日本家は木で造る
Japanese houses are built of wood.
家具は木で造る
Furniture is made of wood.
大工が木取る
Carpenters dress timber―trim timber.
木の目
the grain of wood
木の節
a knot
節だらけの木
knotty wood
節の無い木
wood clear from knots―free stuff
木で鼻をくくったような返事
a curt answer―a snappish answer―a tart rejoinder
木で鼻をくくったような返事をする
to answer snappishly―snap one's nose off

ぎ〔偽〕
〈形〉False (modesty); mock (sun or moon); sham (fight); spurious (article); counterfeit (coin, etc.)

content:
ぎ〔儀〕
〈名〉The matter

content.content: この儀如何に取計いましょうか
How shall I deal with the matter?
その儀よしなに取はからえ
Dispose of the matter at your discretion.
この儀しかと頼んだぞ
I charge you to see to the matter.
その儀については
As regards that matter,...
その儀に及ばず
That is unnecessary.
その儀ばかりは
I will do anything but that.

content:
ぎ〔妓〕
〈名〉A singing girl; a dancing girl

content.content: 妓を聘す
to engage singing girls (for a drinking party)

content:
ぎ〔技〕
〈名〉Art; skill

content.content: 技を揮るう
to display one's art―exhibit one's skill
技を競う
to vie with each other in art―rival each other in skill

ぎ〔擬〕
〈接頭詞〉Sham (fight); mock (trial); pseudo(-Christian, etc.)

content:
ぎ〔義〕
〈名〉
1. (=正義)right; justice

content.content: 仁義
justice and humanity
義の軍
a righteous war
義の為に事を挙げる
to raise a righteous war
義の為に戦う
to fight in the cause of justice―battle for the right
義の為に生命を棄てる
to die in the cause of justice―die a martyr
義を見てせざるは勇無きなり
Not to do what is right in one's sight, argues a want of courage―(西洋風に言えば)―Do what is right in your sight.

content: 2. (=大義)the cause of justice; the good cause; one's cause

content.content: 義は泰山よりも重く命は鴻毛よりも軽し
I hold my life at nothing as compared with my cause.
義の為に働く、義を唱える
to labour in the cause of justice
死者函首
Some martyred heads are sent to glut

content:
きおく〔記憶〕
〈名〉Memory; remembrance; recollection:(=する) to remember; to recollect; to memorize:(思い出す)to recollect; to call (anything) to mind; to recall (anything) to one's mind:(ふと思い出す)to think of (anything):(忘れずに覚えてる)to remember:(忘れぬように覚えている)to kept (anything) in mind; to bear (anything) in mind:(覚える、暗記する)to commit (anything) to memory; to learn (anything) by heart; get (anything) by heart:(米国では)to memorize

content.content: 君は記憶が好いか
Have you a good memory?
あの人は非常に記憶が好い
He has a retentive memory―a tenacious memory―a long memory.
僕は記憶が悪い
I have a bad memory―a poor memory―a short memory.
僕は記憶が悪いからなんでもかんでも筆記するのだ
I have a poor memory, and that is why I take notes of everything.
僕は記憶が悪くて(忘れっぽくて)始終人の名を忘れる
I have a bad memory, and am constantly forgetting people's names.
記憶を好くする
to improve one's memory
俗説に小指の爪を伸ばすと記憶が好くなるという
It is a common saying that allowing the nail of your little finger to grow long improve your memory.
年をとると記憶が悪くなる
My memory fails me as I grow older―Age tells on my memory.
あの人に一度逢ったように記憶している
I remember meeting him once.
どこでか記憶せぬ
(覚えておらぬの意味なら)I do not remember where―(思い出せぬの意味なら)―I can not recollect where.
あの出来事ははっきり記憶している
I have a clear recollection of the event.
かすかに記憶している
I have a faint recollection of it.
ぼんやり記憶している
I have a vague a recollection of it―I have a dim remembrance of it.
記憶に残る
to remain in one's memory―be retained in the memory―hang together in the mind
心にはっきり映ったものは記憶に残る
A clear impression is retained in the memory.
順序無く学んだことは記憶に残らぬ
Without order, things do not hang together in the mind.
その本を読んで何か記憶に残ったか
What have you carried away from book?
記憶にとどまる
to be retained in the memory―impressed on one's memory
あの出来事が深く記憶にとどまっている
The event is deeply impressed on my memory.
あの出来事は記憶を去らぬ(怖くて忘れらぬ)
The event haunts my memory.
彼の名は記憶にとどまっておらぬ(うっかり忘れた)
His name has escaped my memory―slipped my memory.
その出来事は(昨今のことのように)記憶に新しく残っている
The event is still fresh in my memory.
記憶を新しくする、記憶を喚起する
to refresh one's memory―jog one's memory―brush up one's memory―touch up one's memory
記憶を促す
to remind one of anything―put one in mind of anything―make one think of anything―recall anything to one's mind
大地震の記憶を促すものがまだたくさん残っている
Many things still remain which remind us of the great earthquake―recall the great earthquake to our minds.
記憶に浮かぶ
to occur to one's mind
その名を聞いてその人はたちまち記憶に浮かんだ
On hearing his name mentioned, the man at once occurred to my mind―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His name at once suggested the man to my mind.
名を聞いてもその人が記憶に浮かばない
The name does not suggest the man to my mind―recall the man to my mind.
記憶をたどる
to retrace one's memory (to some past event)
記憶をたどってみるとあの人と別れたことをかすかに覚えている
I can retrace my memory to the time when I parted from him.
記憶範囲内の出来事
events within my memory
そんな経験は僕の記憶に無い
Such an experience is not within my memory―It is beyond my memory.
こんな地震は今の人の記憶に無い
It is the greatest earthquake within the memory of the living.
僕の記憶するところでは彼は洋行したことは無いようだ
He has never been abroad to the best of my memory―to (the best of) my recollection.
僕の記憶にして誤り無くば(あるいは覚え間違いかもしれぬが)彼は洋行したことは無い
He has,if I remember aright, never been abroad.
記憶すべき出来事
a memorable event
これは学生の記憶すべきことだ
The student should bear this fact in mind―He should have this fact impressed on his mind.
記憶力
the (faculty of) memory
確かな(信頼すべき)記憶
a trusty memory
不確かな(当てにならぬ)記憶
a treacherous memory

きおくじゅつ〔記憶術〕
〈名〉Mnemonics:(=の) mnemonic

content:
きおくほう〔記憶法〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: きおくじゅつ〔記憶術〕

content:
きおくれ〔気後れ〕
〈名〉Faint-heartedness:(=する) to lose heart; to falter

content.content: この困難を見ては気後れせざるを得ぬ
I can not but falter―I can not help losing heart―My heart fails me―My heart dies within me―My heart sinks within me―at the sight of the difficulties.

content:
きおち〔気落ち〕
〈名〉Despondency; dejection; discouragement:(=する) to despond; to be dejected; to be cast down; to be discouraged; to be disheartened; to lose heart

content.content: 彼は失敗と聞いて気落ちするだろう
He will be dejected―cast down―at the news of his failure.
この困難を見ては気落ちする
I lose heart―My heart fails me―My heart dies within me―My heart sinks within me―at the sight of the difficulties.

content:
きおもい〔気重い〕
〈形〉Heavy-hearted; dull; sluggish; phlegmatic

content.content: 気重い人だ
He is a man of a heavy disposition―of a dull disposition―of a sluggish disposition―of a phlegmatic temperament.

content:
きおれ〔気折れ〕
〈名〉Breaking of the spirit:(=する) to have one's spirit broken

content.content: 年をとると気折れする
Age breaks one's spirit.

content:
きおん〔気温〕
〈名〉Atmospheric temperature

content.content: 春は気温の激変がある
Springtime is subject to sudden changes in the temperature.

content:
きおん〔気音〕
〈名〉Aspirate; aspiration

content.content: 気音子韻
an aspirate (consonant)

content:
ぎおん〔擬音〕
〈名〉Onomatopoeia

content.content: 擬音詞
an onomatopoeia

content:
ぎおんしょうじゃ〔祇園精舎〕
〈名〉A Buddhist temple

content.content: 祇園精舎の鐘の音諸行無情の響あり
The temple-bell proclaims the vanity of earthly things.

content:
きか〔奇禍〕
〈名〉A misfortune; a calamity

content.content: 奇禍に遭遇した
I met with a misfortune―A calamity happened to me.

content:
きか〔奇貨〕
〈名〉
1. (=奇宝)a curious treasure; a curiosity
2. (=好機)an opportunity

content.content: 奇貨措くべし
We must avail ourselves of this opportunity.
何を奇貨とする
to take advantage of anything
彼は主人の不在を奇貨としてたかりに来たのだ
He took advantage of the master's absence to extort money under false pretences.

content:
きか〔幾何〕
〈名〉Geometry:(=の) geometrical

content.content: 平面幾何
plane geometry
立体幾何
solid geometry
解析幾何
analytical geometry
幾何書法
descriptive geometry
幾何級数
a geometrical progression (or series)
幾何学者
a geometrician―a geometer

content:
きか〔帰化〕
〈名〉Naturalization; expatriation:(=する) to be naturalized; to expatriate oneself

content.content: 彼は生まれはイタリア人で米国へ帰化したのだ
He is an Italian by birth, and has been naturalized in the United States―naturalized as an American citizen.
帰化人
a naturalized citizen

きか〔気化〕
〈名〉Evaporation:(=する) to evaporate

きか〔貴下〕
〈代名詞〉(The honorific for) you

content:
きか〔麾下〕
〈名〉Troops (or ships) under one's command:(=の) under one's command

content.content: 彼は東郷大将の麾下に属していた
He served under Adm. Togo.

content:
きが〔起臥〕
〈名〉Daily life

content.content: 起臥を共にする
to live under the same roof―eat off the same trencher

content:
きが〔飢餓〕
〈名〉Hunger; starvation

content.content: 飢餓に迫る
to be pressed by hunger―Starvation stares one in the face
人は飢餓に迫って働く
Men work under the pressure of hunger―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Hunger drives people to work.
彼らは飢餓に頻している
They are on the brink of starvation―They are facing starvation.
飢餓をしのぐ
to avert starvation―“Keep the wolf from the door.”

content:
きかい〔器械〕
〈名〉An instrument; an apparatus; an appliance

content.content: この器械は扱いにくい
The instrument is difficult to handle.
医療器械
a medical appliance
物理器械
a physical apparatus
(物理の)器械室
an apparatus-room
製図器械
drawing instruments
器械書学
instrumental drawing
器械体操
heavy gymnastics

content:
きかい〔奇怪〕
〈形〉
1. (=不思議)strange (occurrence); wonderful (event); marvellous (deed); mysterious (fate); weird (tale); unearthly (look); uncanny (voice in the air, etc.)

content.content: 彼は実に奇怪な運命であった
He was doomed to a mysterious end.

content: 2. (=けしからん)extraordinary, scandalous (conduct); impertinent, impudent, insolent (behaviour); outrageous, atrocious (doings)

content.content: 奇怪千万である
This is insolence!―Impertinence!
己に謝まれとは奇怪千万である
It is outrageous that they should require me to apologize.

content:
きかい〔機会〕
〈名〉An opportunity; a chance; an occasion; time; a moment

content.content: ほどなく機会があった
It was not long before an opportunity presented itself―an opportunity occurred―an opportunity offered.
機会があったら思う存分腹いせをしてやる
I will have it out with him whenever I have a chance.
機会があったら話しておこう
I will take occasion to speak to him.
機会のあり次第に話しておこう
I will speak to him on the first opportunity.
こんな機会はめったに無い
Such opportunities do not occur every day.
機会に乗ずる
to seize an opportunity―seize the moment
機会を逸する、機会をはずす
to miss an opportunity―let slip an opportunity―lose one's chance
君は千載一遇の機会を逸したのだ
You have thrown away a golden opportunity.
彼はのろまでいつも機会をはずす
His slowness always loses him his chance.
機会をはずすな
“Take time by the forelock.”
機会をはずして残念なことをした
It might have been.
僕は金持ちになればなれるのだったに機会をはずして残念なことをした
I might have been a rich man.
機会を待つ
to watch for an opportunity―look out for a chance―bide one's time
洋行したいので機会を待っている
I wish to go abroad, and am on the watch for a chance―on the lookout for a chance.
今や遅しと機会を待った
I eagerly watched for my opportunity.
機会を得る
to get a chance―find an opportunity
出世の機会を得る
to get a chance in life
計画だけで実行する機会を得なかった
I had no opportunity of carrying my design into execution.
その機会を得ず
The chance was denied me.
洋行する機会を得なかった
It was denied me to study abroad.
洋行する機会を得る人は少ない
It is not given to everybody to complete his studies abroad.
その人に会う機会を得なかった
I could not get at the man.
今日は一発も撃つ機会を得なかった
I did not get a shot today.
機会を利用する
to avail oneself of an opportunity―make the most of an opportunity―(小言などを言うためなら)―improve the occasion
あらゆる機会を利用して英語を熟練すべしだ
You must avail yourself of every opportunity to practise your English.
こんな機会は(めったに無いから)でき得る限り利用すべしだ
We must make the most of the opportunity.
この機会を利用して経済の必要を説いた
I improved the occasion to urge the necessity of economy.
これを機会として閣下に深厚の敬意を表す
I take this opportunity to present my highest esteem to Your Excellency.
機会均等主義
the principle of equal opportunity

content:
きかい〔機械〕
〈名〉
1. A machine:(集合的に言えば) machinery(は単数集合名詞):(時計などの機械) works

content.content: 機械を操縦する
to work a machine―operate a machine
この機械は扱い方がむつかしい
The machine is hard to work.
機械が運転する
A machine runs.
機械が運転している
The machinery is in motion.
機械は昼夜運転している
The machinery is running night and day.
機械を運転する
to set the machinery in motion―set the machine going
この機械は電気で運転する
The machine is worked by electricity.
機械の運転を止める
to stop the machinery
この機械は運転ができる
The machine is in working order.
機械を据えつける
to set up a machine―install machinery
機械が整頓している
The machine is in good order―The machine is in working order.
機械が狂っている
The machine is out of order.
狂った機械を直す
to put a machine in order
この子は機械を分解することが好きだ
The boy likes to take a machine to pieces.
印刷機械
a printing-machine―a printing-press―a press
製氷機械
a machine for making ice
これは米をつく機械です
This is a machine to clean rice.
紡績機械
a spinning-jenny
機械学
mechanics
機械工学
mechanical engineering
機械学者
a mechanical engineer
機械師
a mechanician―a mechanist―a machinist
機械力
the mechanical powers
機械水雷
a mechanical mine
機械水雷を敷設する
to lay mines
機械水雷に触れる
to strike a mine―hit a mine
機械製作
machine construction
機械製
articles made by machinery―machine-made goods
時計の機械
the works of a watch
(時計の)機械に故障がある
Something is wrong with the works.

content: 2. (=仕掛け)machinery; mechanism

content.content: 機械仕掛け
mechanism
精巧な機械
delicate machinery―delicate mechanism

content:
きがい〔危害〕
〈名〉An injury

content.content: 危害を加える
to do one an injury
人体に危害を加える
to inflict a bodily injury on one
危害を受ける
to sustain an injury―suffer an injury

content:
きがい〔気概〕
〈名〉An indomitable spirit; a noble spirit; public spirit; high soul; noble sentiment

content.content: 気概は高山彦九郎
For public spirit, give me Takayama Hikokuro!
彼の為す事は気概がある
His actions breathe of a noble spirit.
彼は気概があるだけに事をする
He acts up to his sentiments.
彼の詩は気概がある
His poems are full of soul.
あの人は気概がある
He has a noble spirit―noble sentiments.
あの男は気概が無い
He has no soul.
気概家
a noble-spirited man―a high-souled man―a public-spirited man

content:
ぎかい〔議会〕
〈名〉A deliberative assembly:(殊に)the Diet; the House:(英国にては)the Parliament:(米国にては)the Congress:(仏国にては)the Chamber of Deputies; the National Assembly:(ドイツにては)the Reichstag:(ロシアにては)the Duma

content.content: 帝国議会
the Imperial Diet
第四十議会
the fortieth session of the Diet
議会を召集する
to convoke the Diet―convence the Diet
第四十議会は来る十二月二十五日をもって召集せらる
The Diet has been convoked to meet on Dec.25th for the fortieth session.
臨時議会を召集する
to convoke an extraordinary session of the Diet
議会召集
the convocation of the Diet
議会の開院式
the opening of the Diet
議会の開院式を行わせらる
The Emperor opens the Diet.
議会は開期中(でない)
The Diet is (not) in session.
議会の閉会
the prorogation of the Diet
議会を閉会する
to prorogue the Diet
議会が閉会になる
The Diet is prorogued.
議会の休会
the adjournment of the Diet
議会は一週間休会する
The Diet adjourns for a week.
議会の停会
the suspension of the Diet
議会の停会を命ずる
to suspend the Diet
議会が停会になる
The Diet is suspended.
議会の解散
the dissolution of the Diet
議会を解散する
to dissolve the Diet
議会が解散になる
The Diet is dissolved.
議会の協賛を経る
to obtain the approval of the Diet
議会に議案を提出する
to present a bill to the Diet
議会が議案を可決する
The House passes a bill.
議会が議案を否決する
The House rejects a bill.
議案が議会を通過する
The bill passes the House.
明日議会があるか
Does the House meet tomorrow?
今度の議会
the next session of the Diet

content:
きかいすいらい〔機械水雷〕
〈名〉A mechanical mine

content.content: 機械水雷を敷設する
to lay mines
機械水雷に触れる
to strike a mine―hit a mine

きかいせい〔機械製〕
〈名〉Machine-made (goods); (articles) made by machinery

きかいたいそう〔器械体操〕
〈名〉Heavy gymnastics

content:
きかいてき〔機械的〕
〈形〉Mechanical

content.content: 機械的の仕事
mechanical work
機械的に働く
to work mechanically
(精神を入れずに)機械的に仕事をした
I went about my task mechanically.

きかいばた〔機械織機〕
〈名〉A power-loom

content:
きがえ〔着換え〕
〈名〉A change of clothes; spare clothing:(=する) to change one's clothes

content.content: 着換えが一枚も無い
I have no spare clothes―no clothes but those I stand up in.

content:
きかえる〔着替える〕
〈他動〉To change (one's clothes)

content.content: 着物を着替えて出かけよう
I will go out in different clothes.
着替えずにそのままお出で
Come in the clothes you stand up in.

content:
きかがく〔幾何学〕
〈名〉Geometry:(=の) geometrical

content.content: 平面幾何学
plane geometry
立体幾何学
solid geometry
解析幾何学
analytical geometry
幾何学者
a geometrician―a geometer

content:
きがかり〔気懸り〕
〈名〉Anxiety; concern; solicitude; a weight on one's mind

content.content: 気懸りになる
to weigh on one's mind
この借金が気懸りでならぬ
This debt is a weight on my mind―This debt weighs on my mind.
君は何か気懸りなことがあるか
Have you anything on your mind?
試験の成績が気懸りでならなかった(今まで気がもめた)
The result of my examination has kept me in suspense.

content:
きがきく〔気が利く〕
〈自動〉To have judgment; to have good sense; to have sound sense; to have sterling sense; to have tact; to have savoir faire; to have a head on one's shoulders; to be sensible; to be knowing; to be smart

content.content: あの女中は山出しにしては気が利いている
She is smart for a girl fresh from the mountains.
日本人は気が利く
The Japanese have judgment―have good sense.
芸者は概して気が利いている
Geisha generally have savoir faire.
あの男はなかなか気が利く
He is a knowing fellow―He has a head on his shoulders.
彼の返事が気が利いている
His answer was sensible.
あの女は心は好いが気が利かない
She has a good heart, but on head.
彼は判断力に乏しい、俗に言う気が利かないのだ
He is wanting in judgment. He has, in common parlance, no head.
あの女は支度が気が利いている、気が利かない
She dresses in good taste―in bad taste.
支度が立派過ぎて気が利かない
Her dress is too rich for good taste.
はたの者が気が利かない
The others are slow to take the hint.
待ちぼうけ食うのは気が利かない
It would be awkward to have to wait in vain.
汽車に乗り後れちゃ気が利かないからね
It would be awkward to miss the train.

ぎかくし〔擬革紙〕
〈名〉Imitation-leather; leather-paper

content:
きがけに〔来掛けに〕
〈副〉When coming; on my way here

content.content: 来がけにちょっと寄ってきた
I looked in on my way here.

content:
きかざる〔着飾る〕
〈自動〉To dress up; to be dressed out; to dress finely

content.content: 彼はたいそう着飾っている
He is finely dressed―He is a swell―He looks very swell.
皆今日を晴れと着飾っている
They are in their best―dressed out in their Sunday clothes.

content:
きかす〔利かす〕
〈他動〉To use

content.content: 気を利かす
to use judgment―use one's head―take the hint
気を利かしてその場をはずした
I took the hint, and kept out of the way―I discreetly kept out of the way.
幅を利かす
to lay down the law
彼は町内で幅を利かしている
He lays down the law in the neighbourhood―He has influence over his neighbours―He is the cock of the walk.
気転を利かす
to show one's presence of mind
粋を利かす
to consider one's feelings―show delicacy
通を利かす
to show one's knowledge of the world
融通を利かす、変通を利かす
to accommodate oneself to circumstances―adapt oneself to new conditions

content:
きかずに〔聴かずに〕
〈前置詞相当〉In defiance of

content.content: 彼は医者の止めるのも聴かずに相変らず飲んでいる
He keeps on drinking in defiance of his doctor's warning.

content:
きかせる〔聞かせる〕
〈他動〉To tell (one a story or some news―one of an event or that...); to inform (one of an event); to let (one) hear; to let (one) know

content.content: 先生、なにかお話を聞かせて下さい
Sir, please tell us a story!
何の話を聞かせましょうか
What shall I tell you about?
彼が死んだことを皆に聞かした
I have told them that he is dead―told them of his death.
僕が着いたことを皆に聞かせたか
Have you told them that I have arrived?―told them of my arrival?
事のいきさつをお聞かせ下さい
Tell me how it happened.
読んで聞かせよう
I will read to you.
面白い話を読んで聞かせよう
I will read you an interesting story.
唄を歌って聞かせ給え
Sing me a song!―Favour me with a song!
一曲聞かしてくれ給え
Please play me a tune!―favour me with a tune!
あの婦人の唄を君に聞かせたかった
You should have heard her sing.
君に聞かせたいことがある
I have news for you!―Here is news for you!
このことを親父に聞かせたくない
The affair must not come to my father's ears.
この話は君だけに聞かせるのだ
The story is for your private ears.
人に秘密を聞かせる
to let one into the secret
彼にも秘密を聞かしておく必要がある
We must let him into the secret―He must be let into the secret.
僕の言うことをぜひ聴かせる
I will be obeyed.

content:
きかつ〔飢渇〕
〈名〉Hunger and thirst; starvation

content.content: 飢渇をしのぐ
to keep off starvation―“keep the wolf from the door.”
飢渇に迫る
to be pressed by hunger
人は飢渇に迫って働く
Men work under the pressure of hunger―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Hunger drives people to work.

content:
きがつく〔気が付く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=気づく)to notice; to perceive; to remark; to become aware of (a fact)

content.content: あの癖には誰でも気がつく
Everybody remarks that peculiarity of his.
主婦は万事に気がつく
The mistress remarks everything.
よく気がつく人だ
He is quick to perceive everything―He is quick of perception―He is quick in anticipating your wishes.
大勢いたからその人に気がつかなかった
I did not notice him in the crowd.
悪いと気がついたら謝まるがよい
If you perceive your fault, you ought to acknowledge it.
いかにぼんやりでもこれほど違ったら気がつきそうなものだ
The dullest eye would see the difference.
汽車を乗り違えて一時間ほどたってようやく気がついた
I took the wrong train by mistake, and it was an hour before I became aware of my mistake.
好いところへ気がついた
Well said!―It is a word in season.

content: 2. (=正気がつく)to come to (oneself)

content.content: 気がついて見ると見慣れないところに寝ておった
When I came to, I found myself lying in a strange place.
冷たい風に当たって気がついた
The cold air brought me to (myself).

きかない〔聴かない〕
〈形〉(A woman or a lad) of spirit

content:
きがね〔気兼ね〕
〈名〉Constraint:(=する) to feel constrained; to be afraid of giving trouble; to be afraid of giving offence; to have a regard for one's feelings; to spare one's feelings

content.content: 誰でもあの人には気がねする
Everybody feels constrained in his presence.
あの人は気の毒なほど気がねする
He is afraid of giving trouble―afraid of giving offence―to a painful extent.
給仕人に気がねしいしい飯を食っている
He dines in constant fear of giving trouble to the waiter.
気がねして暮らすのはいやだ
I don't like to live in constant fear of giving trouble.
この家は気がねが無くて好い
You feel no constraint―feel at home―in this house.
あの人は気がねが無い
He makes you feel at home―You feel at home with him―He puts you at your ease.
僕に気がねはいらない(から遠慮無く何でも言い給え)
You need have no regard for my feelings―You need not spare my feelings.
僕は彼に気がねして黙っておった
I kept silent out of regard for his feelings―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A regard for his feelings kept me silent.
彼は主人に気がねして酒を飲まないのだ
He abstains from wine out of regard for his master.
嫁は姑に気がねして好きな道を慎んでいる
She refrains from her favourite amusement out of regard for her mother-in-law.
僕は気がねをしいしい人の家に厄介になるのはいやだ
I do not like to impose upon the hospitality of my friends.

きがはやい〔気が早い〕
〈形〉Hasty; excitable

content:
きがまえ〔気構え〕
〈名〉Being prepared for anything

content.content: 僕は行かれないかも知れないからその気構えでいて下さい
You must be prepared for my absence.

きがみ〔生紙〕
〈名〉Unsized Japanese paper

content:
きがる〔気軽〕
〈形〉Light of heart; light-hearted; gay; cheerful; buoyant

content.content: 気軽な人だ
He is a light-hearted man―He has a buoyant spirit.

content:
きがわりする〔気変りする〕
〈自動〉To change one's mind

content.content: 気変わりしないうちに(頂戴しておこう)
I will trouble you for it before you change your mind.

content: 〈形〉Fickle; inconstant

content.content: よく気変わりする人だ
He is a man of moods.

content:
きかん〔器官、機官〕
〈名〉An organ

content.content: 機管にはおのおのその機能あり
Each organ has its function.
消化器官
the digestive organs
生殖器官
the genital organs

content:
きかん〔器官、機官〕
〈名〉An organ

content.content: 機管にはおのおのその機能あり
Each organ has its function.
消化器官
the digestive organs
生殖器官
the genital organs

content:
