Such is the power of money―Money tells.
人によっては僅かの親切がたいそう利き目がある
A little kindness goes far with some people―goes a long way with some people.

content:
ききもの〔聞き物〕
〈名〉Something worth hearing

content.content: あの人の演説は聞き物だ
He is worth hearing.

content:
ききもらす〔聞き洩らす〕
〈他動〉To miss hearing; to fail to hear

content.content: その名を聞きもらした
I did not hear his name―His name escaped my ear.
彼は一言一句も聞きもらさない
He does not miss a single word―He catches every word.

content:
ききゃく〔棄却〕
〈名〉
1. (=放棄)abandonment; renunciation:(=する) to abandon (a project); to renounce (one's rights)
2. (=却下)rejection; dismissal:(=する) to reject, dismiss (a case)

content.content: 上告を棄却する
to reject an appeal―dismiss an appeal

content:
ききゅう〔危急〕
〈名〉A crisis; an emergency; an exigency; an imminent danger:(=の) critical; imminent; exigent

content.content: この危急の際に
at this crisis
この危急存亡の秋に
in this crisis―in this exigency―in this emergency
危急の場合には
in case of emergency―in case of need
国家危急存亡の秋である
This is a national crisis.
危急に頻す
to be in imminent danger
危急に備える
to provide against emergencies

content:
ききゅう〔帰休〕
〈名〉Discharge (of a soldier) before the expiration of term of service

content.content: 帰休除隊になる
to be discharged before the expiration of one's term of service
帰休兵
a soldier discharged before time

content:
ききゅう〔気球〕
〈名〉A balloon

content.content: 気球隊
a balloon corps
係留気球
a captive balloon

content:
ききょ〔起居〕
〈名〉
1. (=安否)one's state of health

content.content: 起居を問う
to ask after one―inquire after one
御起居如何に御座候哉{ごきよいかがにござそうろうや}
I trust you are in good health.

content: 2. (=日々の生活)daily life

content.content: 起居を共にする
to live under the same roof―eat off the same trencher

content: 3. (=振舞)behaviour

ぎきょ〔義挙〕
〈名〉A noble project; a heroic undertaking; philanthropic work

ききょう〔奇矯〕
〈名〉Whim:(=の) whimsical

ききょう〔帰京〕
〈名〉Return to town:(=する) to return to town

content:
ききょう〔帰郷〕
〈名〉Return to one's native place:(=する) to go home; to come home

content.content: 彼は賜暇帰郷中
He is home on leave.

ききょう〔桔梗〕
〈名〉A kind of bell-flower (one of the three classic autumn flowers)

content:
きぎょう〔企業〕
〈名〉Enterprise

content.content: 企業心
enterprise―initiative
東洋人は企業心が無い
The Orientals lack enterprise―They have on initiative.
企業熱
a mania for enterprises
欧州戦乱につれて企業熱が勃興した
The European war gave rise to a mania for new enterprises.
企業家
a man of enterprise―an enterprising man
企業家同盟
a trust
企業組合
a syndicate

content:
きぎょう〔機業〕
〈名〉Weaving industry; textile industry

content.content: 機業家
a textile man
機業地
a textile country

content:
きぎょう〔起業〕
〈名〉Origination; initiation:(=する) to originate a scheme; to launch an enterprise; to set a project on foot; to initiate an undertaking

content.content: 起業費
initial expenses
起業公債
an industrial loan

content:
ぎきょう〔義侠〕
〈名〉Chivalry; heroism

content.content: 義侠に富める人だ
He is a chivalrous man―a heroic man.

content:
ぎきょうしん〔義侠心〕
〈名〉Chivalry; chivalrous sentiment; a chivalrous spirit; a heroic spirit; noble impulses; generous impulses

content.content: 彼は義侠心がある
He is chivalrous―heroic―(こっけいに言えば)―quixotic.
君は義侠心があるね
How can you be so noble?
義侠心に富む
There is a great deal of chivalry in his nature.
義侠心を養う
to give free play to noble and generous impulses
義侠心を出す
to show noble generosity―“help a lame dog over a stile”

ぎきょうだい〔義兄弟〕
〈名〉Brothers-in-law; sworn brothers

ききょく〔危極〕
〈名〉A crisis:(殊に) a commercial crisis

ききょく〔帰極〕
〈名〉Polarization:(=する) to polarize

content:
ぎきょく〔戯曲〕
〈名〉A dramatic piece; a drama; a play

content.content: 戯曲作者
a dramatist―a playwright

ききょくせい〔帰極性〕
〈名〉Polarity

content:
ききわけ〔聞き分け〕
〈名〉Listening to reason; reasonableness:(=る) to be reasonable; to listen to reason; to come to reason; to consent

content.content: 幼な心に聞き分けて主人のために死んでくれた
The child listened to reason, and died for his master.
聞き分けの好い子だ
He is a reasonable child.
お前は聞き分けが無くて困る
You will not listen to reason―You are unreasonable.
やっと聞き分けた
At length, he has come to reason―consented.

content:
ききん〔基金〕
〈名〉A fund; a foundation; an endowment

content.content: 基金を募集する
to collect a fund
国債償還基金
the sinking fund
彼は基金給費生だ
He is a foundationer―on the foundation.

content:
ききん〔飢饉〕
〈名〉Famine; scarcity; dearth

content.content: シベリアは飢饉だ
There is a famine in Siberia―Siberia is famine-stricken.
飢饉地
a famine-stricken district
飢饉に備える
to provide against a famine
飢饉の備えに米を貯蔵する
to store rice against a famine
飢饉年
a year of scarcity―a lean year
飢饉救済資金
a famine relief fund

ぎきん〔義金〕
〈名〉A subscription; a contribution

ききんぞく〔貴金属〕
〈名〉The precious metals; the noble metals; the perfect metals

content:
きく〔危懼〕
〈名〉Fears; apprehensions

content.content: 危懼の念を懐く
to entertain apprehensions

きく〔規矩〕
〈名〉A standard; a criterion; a rule

きく〔起句〕
〈名〉The opening line (of a poem)

content:
きく〔菊〕
〈名〉The chrysanthemum

content.content: 菊を作る
to rear chrysanthemums
菊の御紋
the Imperial chrysanthemum crest
菊人形
chrysanthemum figures
六日のあやめ十日の菊
It is too late―a day after the fair.

content:
きく〔聴く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=傾聴する)to listen to (one):(古文体では) to attend to (one's words):(その他は) to hear (one); to mind (what one says); to mark (one's words)

content.content: 僕の言うことを聴いてくれ
Listen to me!―Hear me!［注意］「言うことを聴く」の「言うこと」(what one says)を略して代名詞のみを用いる。
今度だけ僕の言うことを聴いて下さい
Listen to me for this once!
僕の言うことをしまいまで聴いて下さい
Hear me to the end!―Hear me out!
彼は誰が言っても聴かない
He will listen to nobody.
そんな目に逢うのは人の言うことを聴かないからだ
That comes of neglecting my advice.
音楽を聴く
to listen to music
琵琶歌はいつ聴いても好い
I never tire of listening to biwa songs.
説教を聴く
to listen to a sermon―hear a sermon
君は誰の説教を聴くか
Whom do you sit under?
あの人の話はいつ聴いても面白い
I never tire of hearing his stories.
忠告を聴く
to listen to advice―follow one's advice
謹んで聴いております
I am all attention.
あれ聴け、雨の音
Hark! Don't you hear the rain?
よく聴けよ
Mind (you)!―Mark my words!
そんなことは聴く耳持たぬ
I can not be listening to such nonsense.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 隣室で自分の話しが出たので鳴りを静めて聴いた
When I found that they were talking about me in the next room, I was all ears.
牧師の説教を聴く
to sit under a minister
人の忠告などを聴かぬ
to disregard one's advice―neglect one's advice―defy one's advice―set one's advice at defiance―set one's advice at naught
そんな目に逢うのは人の言うことを聴かないからだ
That comes of neglecting my advice.
彼は親の意見も聴かずに放蕩を止めぬ
He sets paternal authority at naught, and keeps on his evil courses.
彼は医者の注意も聴かずに相変らず飲んでいる
He sets his doctor's warning at defiance, and keeps on drinking―He keeps on drinking in defiance of his doctor's warning.
彼はどうしても行かなきゃならんと言って聴かぬ
He insists on going.
彼は僕にどうしても行けと言って聴かぬ
He insists on my going.
彼は酒が滋養になると言って聴かぬ
He will have it that alcohol is a food.
あれほど忠告しても彼は聴かぬ
All my advice is lost upon him.
彼は人が忠告してもさらに聴かない
He gives no heed to warning―turns a deaf ear to advice.
彼は「いかん」と言い出したらどうしても聴かない
When he says “No,” he puts his foot down.

content: 3. (=聴き入れる)to grant, comply with, accede to (a request); to grant, do (one a favour)

content.content: 彼は僕の願いを聴いてくれた
He granted my request―complied with my request―acceded to my request.
君にお願いがある聴いてくれんか
Will you grant my request?―comply with my request?―grant me a favour?―do me a favour?―oblige me?
彼は僕の嘆願を聴いてくれた
He listened to my entreaties.
彼は人が嘆願しても聴かばこそ
He will turn a deaf ear to your entreaties―He is deaf to entreaty.

content: 4. (=命に従う)to obey (orders)

content.content: 親の言うことは聴くものだ
You should obey your parents.
俺の言うことを聴け
Obey me!―Mind what I say!
先生の言うことを聴きませんか
Will you not obey your teacher?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 女が男の言うことを聴く
A woman surrenders her chastity to a man―gives herself to a man.

content:
きく〔聞く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=聞知する)to hear (a sound, a voice, a story, a speech, some news―of an event―that some one is dead); to learn (a fact―of an event)

content.content: その話は聞いたことがある
I have heard that story.
その話を聞きたいものだ
I am curious to hear the story.
面白いことを聞いたか
Have you heard the news?
彼は返事も聞かずに行ってしまった
He was off without waiting to hear my answer.
このことについてご意見が聞きたいものだ
I should like to hear your opinion on the subject.
鐘の音を聞く
to hear the bell
雨の音を聞く
to hear the rain［注意］英語では「何の音を聞く」の「音」を略す。また「人の言うことを聞く」を略して代名詞のみを用いる。例えば
僕の言うことを聞いてくれ
Hear me!―Listen to me!
僕の言うことをしまいまで聞いて下さい
Hear me to the end!―Hear me out!
あの人の言うことを聞くと何でも知っていそうだ
To hear him, one would think he knew everything.
あの人の演説を聞いたか
Have you heard his speech?―Have you heard him speak in public?―Have you heard him?
彼の演説を聞きたかった
I should like to have heard him.
わざわざ聞きに行くほどの演説でない
I would not go out of my way to hear him.
彼が病気だということを聞いたか
Have you heard that he is ill?―heard of his illness?
彼が死んだと聞いた
I have heard that he is dead―heard of his death.
火事と聞いて早速駈けつけた
When I heard that there was a fire,―On hearing of a fire,―I hastened to the scene without delay.
そういう人のあることはかねて噂に聞いている
I have heard that there is such a man―(を略して)―heard of such a man.
聞いて極楽見て地獄
It is a Paradise to hear of, a Hell to see.
君は伊藤の話を聞いたか
Have you heard about Ito?
鳥のさえずるのを聞く
I hear the birds sing.
僕は彼がそう言うのを聞いた
I have heard him say so.
誰かの話しにフランス語はやさしいように聞いている
I have heard some one say―heard it said―that French is easy.
あの人の英語を聞いたことが無い
I never heard him speak English.
あの人の英語を聞くと西洋人かと思う
To hear him speak English, one would take him for a foreigner.
君はロシア語を聞いたことがあるか
Did you ever hear Russian spoken?
君はあの人の歌を聞いたか
Have you heard his song?―Have you heard him sing?
この唄を聞きたいものだ
I should like to hear this song sung.
彼の名を聞いてどんな色男かと思った
On hearing his name mentioned, I pictured to myself a fine gentleman.
これが音に聞く富士山か
Is this that Mt. Fuji which I have heard so much of?
遠からん者は音にも聞け
Ye who are afar, hear and tremble!
耳ある者は聞け
He that hath ears to hear, let him hear!

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: その話を誰に聞いたか
Who told you the story?
田中に聞いた
Tanaka told it me.
この話は本人に聞いた
I have the news at first hand.
確かな筋から聞いた
I have it on good authority.
それは初めて聞いた
That is new to me―news to me.
老人の言うことは聞くものだ
What an old man says, is generally true.
一を聞いて十を知る
“A word to the wise is sufficient.”
彼の話しを聞いてみるとなかなか苦労をしている
According to his account, he has gone through much.
彼は失敗と聞いてがっかりしている
He is dejected at his failure―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His failure has cast him down.
彼は失敗と聞いたら発狂するだろう
He will go mad at the news of his failure―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The news of his failure will drive him mad.
と聞いてがっかり
My spirits fell at the answer.
火事と聞いて皆出口の方へ押し寄せた
At the cry of“Fire!” everybody made for the door.
彼の名を聞いたばかりでびっくりするだろう
They would be frightened at the mere mention of his name.
これを聞いて彼が怒った
At this, he got angry―(他動詞構文にすれば)―This made him angry.
ちょいと聞くと変なようだがしかし真理だ
It may sound strange at the first blush, but it is true for all that.［注意］「読んで聞かせる」(to read to one) より
彼は新聞を読まして聞いている
He has the papers read to him.
人に読まして聞く
to have oneself read to
塙保己一は人に読まして聞いて学者になった
Hanawa Hokiichi made himself a scholar by having himself read to.
風の便りに聞いた
A little bird whispered to me.
話半分に聞け
The story must be taken with a grain of salt―The story must be taken with some grains of allowance.
聞くと見るとは大きな違い
There is a great difference between the fame and the reality―The reality falls short of the fame.
彼は僕の質問を聞かぬふりをした
He took no notice of my question.
文学もないもんだ、聞いてあきれら
Literature, indeed!
聞いたまま
a verbatim report―a word-for-word report
聞いたままを話そう
I will tell you what I heard.

content: 3. (=聞き取る)to follow

content.content: 聞いていますか
Are you following?

content: 4. (=尋ねる)to ask (one a question―one about some matter); to inquire (of some one about some matter); (want) to know

content.content: 君に聞きたいことがある
I want to ask you something.
先生に聞いてみたか
Have you asked your teacher?
僕は住所姓名を聞かれた
I was asked my name and address.
道を聞く
to ask the way―inquire the way
停車場へ行く道を聞いた
I inquired the way to the station.
交番で聞いて家がわかった
I found the house by inquiring at a police-box.
生徒が試験のことを聞きに来た
A student came to inquire of me about the examination.
冗談半分に聞いてみた
I asked the question half in joke.
試験の成績が早く聞きたい
I am anxious to know the result of my examination.
そのわけが聞きたいものだ
I want to know the reason―I should like to know the reason.
ぜひそのわけが聞きたい
I must know the reason―I insist on knowing the reason.
彼はぜひそのわけが聞きたいと主張した
He insisted on knowing the reason.
彼はなんでもかでも聞きたがる
He is curious to know everything―He is very inquisitive.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: それを聞いて何とする
What is that to you?
彼に聞いたらわかるだろう
Perhaps he can throw light on the matter.
彼に聞いたらそのわけがわかるだろう
Perhaps he can tell you the reason.
幹事へ聞きに行った
I went to the secretary for information.
人が聞きに来たら何と言いましょうか
If any one comes to me for information, what shall I say?
なお詳しいことは幹事にお聞き下さい
Please apply to my manager for further particulars―For further particulars, I must refer you to my manager.

content:
きく〔利く〕
〈自動〉
1. To take effect; to have effect on (anything); to act on, work on, operate on, tell on (anything); to do (one) good; to be good for (some disease); to be efficacious; to work

content.content: この薬はよく利く
This medicine is efficacious.
薬が利いた
The medicine has taken effect―done me good.
薬が利き始めた
The medicine begins to work―begins to act―begins to operate.
薬は患部に利く
Medicine works on―acts on―operates on―the affected part.
この薬は不思議に利く
The medicine works like magic―works wonders―does wonders.
キニーネは熱病に利く
Quinine is good for fevers.
薬を飲んでも少しも利かない
The medicine had no effect on me―did me no good.
僕は酒を飲んでも少しも利かない
Wine has no effect on me.
僕の意見がたいそう利いた
My words had great effect on him.
海水浴がたいそう利いた
Sea-bathing has done me much good.
肥やしが利いた
The manure has worked on the soil.
無理をすると身体に利く
The strain will tell on my constitution.
仕事が身体に利いてきた
Hard work begins to tell on me.
試験が利いてきた
The examination is telling on me.
電鈴が利かない
The bell will not work.
この錠前は利かない
The lock will not work―The lock will not act―The lock will not catch.
電車が坂へ来ると歯止めが利かなくなった
When the car was running down a slope, the brake refused to work―the brake refused to act.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 木が腐っていて釘が利かない
The wood is rotten, and the nail will not hold.
鼻が利く
He has a good nose―The dog has a good scent.
風邪を引いて鼻が利かない
I have a cold and no nose.
鼻は使わないと利かなくなる(ばかになる)
One's nose gets out of practice.
犬には鼻の利くのと足の早いのとある
Some dogs are chosen for scent, others for speed.
あの人は目が利く
He is a good judge of swords―a connoisseur of paintings.
彼は年をとって目が利かない
He has grown old, and his eyesight fails him.
年をとって身体が利かぬ
I am old and helpless.
彼は手が利く
He is clever with his hands.
彼は(右の手よりも)左の手の方が利く
He is left-handed.
君は左が利くか
Do you drink?
彼はだいぶ左が利く
He is a hard drinker―a thirsty soul.
彼は腕が利く
He has ability.
彼は右の腕が利かなくなった
He has lost the use of his right arm.
この言葉は利いている
The word is effective.
塩が利き過ぎている
There is too much salt in it.
塩を入れないと砂糖が利かない
Salt brings out the taste of sugar.
この醤油は割が利く
This soy is effective.
この羅紗は洗いが利く
This cloth will wash―stand washing.
この大砲は遠く利く
The gun carries far.
この銃は何間利くか
How far does the gun carry?
大砲が利かぬ
The gun does not carry so far―(的になら)―bear on the mark.
Gibraltar の砲台は艦砲が利かぬ
Ships' guns do not bear on the forts of Gibraltar.
無線電信は長距離に利くものか
Is the wireless telegraphy available for long distances?
船は舵が利く
The ship answers the helm―obeys the helm―feels the helm―steers well―She has an easy steerage.
舵の利かない船だ
She has a hard steerage.
気が利く
to have judgment―have good sense―be sensible―have a head on one's shoulders
彼は気が利かぬ
He has no head―He is awkward.
彼は気転が利く
He has a quick wit―a ready wit―He is quick-witted―ready-witted.
幅が利く
to have influence (over others)
あの店の店員だというとあの辺でちょっと幅が利く
A clerk of that establishment is a somebody in the neighbourhood.
役人は当節は幅が利かない
Officials are nobodies―of no consequence―nowadays.
にらみが利く
to command respect
子どもに嘘をつくとにらみが利かなくなる
If you deceive a child, you can not command respect.
彼は融通が利く
He has good credit―His credit stands well.
一万円の融通が利く
His credit is good for 10,000 yen.
彼は融通が利かなくなった
His credit is cracked.
融通が利かぬ
He has no credit―a cracked credit.
日本人は融通の利く国民だ
The Japanese are an adaptable people.
融通の利く人だ
He is a versatile man―a flexible character.
融通の利かない男だ
He lacks adaptability.
英語は融通の利く言葉だ
English is a flexible language―an elastic language.
日本の巡査は賄賂が利かぬ
The Japanese policeman is proof against corruption.
あの人はおだてが利かぬ
He is proof against flattery.
おどしが利かないものだから歎願と出た
His threats proving of no avail, he betook himself to entreaties.
学生にはそんなごまかしは利かぬ
Such humbug will not go down with students.
彼は押し出しが利く
He has a prepossessing exterior.
自由が利く
to command anything
彼は金の自由が利く
He has money at his command.
数は百で利かない
The number exceeds a hundred―There are over a hundred.

content: 〈他動〉

content.content: 口を利く
to speak―talk
彼は口を利いてくれた
He spoke a good word for me―put in a good word for me.
口の利きようも知らぬ
He does not know how to speak properly.
彼は口数は利かないが要点を言う
He speaks drily, but to the point.
無駄口を利く
to chatter―prattle
無駄口を利くな
Do not waste words―“Keep your breath to cool your porridge.”

content:
きぐ〔危惧〕
〈名〉Fears; apprehensions

content.content: 危惧の念を懐く
to entertain apprehensions

content:
きぐ〔器具〕
〈名〉An implement; an instrument; an apparatus; an appliance

content.content: 軍用器具
the appliances of warfare
農業機具
implements of agriculture

きくいむし〔木食虫〕
〈名〉The wood-borer

きくいも〔菊芋〕
〈名〉The Jerusalem artichoke

きぐう〔奇遇〕
〈名〉An unexpected meeting; a chance encounter

content:
きぐう〔寄寓〕
〈名〉Living with a family:(=する) to live with (a family)

content.content: 彼は西洋人の家に寄寓している
He lives with a foreigner.

content:
きぐすり〔生薬〕
〈名〉A drug

content.content: 生薬屋
a druggist―the druggist's

きくずれ〔気崩れ〕
〈名〉A slump (in the market)

content:
きくたびれ〔気くたびれ〕
〈名〉Mental fatigue:(=する) to be mentally fatigued

content.content: 客の応接で気くたびれした
I am tired of company.

content:
きぐち〔木口〕
〈名〉(Quality of) timber

content.content: 木口が好い
The house is built of good timber.
木口を吟味する
to be choice of timber
木口を吟味して建てた家だ
The house is built of choice timber.

content:
きくばり〔気配り〕
〈名〉Care; vigilance

content.content: 気配りをする
to be careful―vigilant―watchful―on the watch―on the lookout―on the alert

content:
きぐらい〔気位〕
〈名〉A sense of one's importance; pride

content.content: 彼は気位が高い
He has a high sense of his own importance―He is proud.
気位が高いから人の下につけない
He is too proud to play second fiddle.
気位ばかり高くて何もできない
His pride does not correspond with his ability.
お前達はこのように貧乏になって気位が高くては困る
You must bring down your pride to your circumstances.

きくらげ〔木耳〕
〈名〉The Jew's ear

content:
ギクリ
〈名〉A start

content.content: ギクリとする
to give a start (at anything)―be startled (at anything)
と聞いてギクリとした
I was startled at the announcement.

content:
きぐろう〔気苦労〕
〈名〉Care; worry:(=する) to have cares; to worry oneself, be worried (about or over anything)

content.content: 日本の花嫁は姑に気苦労する
The Japanese bride is worried about pleasing her mother-in-law.
彼女は気苦労がありそうだ
She looks worried―She has a worried look.
書生生活は気苦労が無い
Student life is free from care.

content:
ぎぐん〔義軍〕
〈名〉
1. (=正義の戦争)a righteous war

content.content: 義軍を起こす
to raise a righteous war
日本は東洋の平和のために二度義軍を起こした
Japan has twice waged righteous wars―twice battled for the right―in the cause of the peace of the East.

content: 2. (=正義のために戦う軍)an army fighting in the cause of justice

content.content: 我々は義軍である
We fight in the cause of justice―battle for the right.
天は義軍を佑{たす}く
Heaven favours the cause of justice.

ぎくんし〔偽君子〕
〈名〉A hypocrite

content:
きけい〔奇計〕
〈名〉An ingenious stratagem

content.content: 奇計を用いる
to resort to stratagem
奇計をもって城を取る
to take a castle by stratagem

content:
きけい〔奇警〕
〈形〉Pointed (thought); epigrammatic (style); original (views, etc.)

content.content: 君の着眼はすこぶる奇警だ
You have an original way of looking at things.

きけい〔貴兄〕
〈代名詞〉(An honorific for) you:(=の) your:(=に) (to) you:(=を) you

content:
きけい〔畸形〕
〈名〉Deformity; malformation:(=の) deformed; malformed

content.content: 畸形児
a deformed child―a malformed child―a freak of nature

content:
きけい〔詭計〕
〈名〉An evil scheme; a trick; a ruse

content.content: 詭計をめぐらす
to devise a trick
敵の詭計にかかる
to fall a victim to the schemes of the enemy
あれはこちらに油断をさせる詭計だ
That is a ruse to throw us off our guard.

ぎけい〔義兄〕
〈名〉A brother-in-law; a sworn brother

content:
ぎげい〔技芸〕
〈名〉
1. (=技術)an art
2. (=手職)a handicraft; a manual art

content.content: 技芸学校
a handicraft school

content:
きげき〔喜劇〕
〈名〉A comedy:(=の) comic

content.content: 一場の喜劇を演ずる
to enact a comedy
喜劇作者
a comedian―a comedist
喜劇俳優
a comic actor―a comedian
喜劇女優
a comedienne

content:
きけつ〔既決〕
〈名〉Settled (matter); convicted (prisoner)

content.content: 既決問題
a settled question
既決囚
a convicted prisoner―a convict

きけつ〔帰結〕
〈名〉Conclusion; termination; the end; a result

きけつ〔起結〕
〈名〉The beginning and the end; the alpha and omega

きげつ〔期月〕
〈名〉A full mouth

きげつ〔虧月〕
〈名〉The waning moon

content:
ぎけつ〔議決〕
〈名〉The decision (of a meeting):(=する) to decide (on a question); to vote (for a measure)

content.content: 議決権
the right of voting―a vote

content:
きけもの〔利け者〕
〈名〉A man of influence; a person of consequence

content.content: あれは町内の利け者だ
He is a man of influence in the neighbourhood―the cock of the walk.

content:
きける〔利ける〕
〈自動〉To be influential

content.content: 若い時は利けたものだ
He was somebody in his day.

content:
きけん〔危険〕
〈名〉Danger; peril; jeopardy; menace:(損をするような危険は)risk; hazard:(=な) dangerous (attempt); perilous (voyage); risky (enterprise); hazardous (business); critical (state); precarious (life); breakneck (path, etc.)

content.content: この家は危険だ
(住まうのなら)The house is dangerous―(火事の風上でなら)―The house is in danger.
生命が危険だ
His life is in danger―Ha is in danger of losing his life―in peril of his life.
この手術は危険でないか
Isn't this operation attended with danger?
この手術は危険は無い
This operation is attended with no danger―free from danger.
この事業は危険だ(損失の憂いあり)
It is a risky enterprise―a hazardous enterprise.
この商売は危険が無い
The business is free from risks.
前途に危険あり
Breakers ahead!
この企画は危険が多い
The enterprise is fraught with dangers.
これは東洋の平和に対する危険である
This is a menace to the peace of the East.
そんな危険があろうとは夢にも知らなかった
I was quite unconscious of any such danger.
危険に陥る
to run into danger
彼は危険に陥っている
He is in danger.
危険を脱する
to get out of danger―escape from danger
危険を避ける
to keep out of danger―avert a danger―ward off dangers
危険に遭遇する
to encounter a danger
彼はどんな危険に逢っても自若としている
He is self-possessed in any danger.
危険に逢わせる
to expose one to danger
危険に臨む
to be in presence of danger
彼はどんな危険に臨んでもびくともせぬ
He will not turn a hair in presence of any danger―in the face of any danger.
危険の間に立って冷静自若としている
He is cool and steady amidst dangers.
彼は危険に迫っている
He is in imminent danger.
君の身に危険が降りかかっている
A danger impends over your head.
迫れる危険、降りかかれる危険
an imminent danger―an impending danger
危険を冒す
to brave a danger―face a danger―defy a danger―dare a danger―tempt Providence―fly in the face of Providence―(損をする危険なら)―run a risk―run a hazard
危険を冒して進んだ
We advanced in defiance of danger―in the face of danger.
どんな危険を冒しても(どんなことをしても)行かずにはおかぬ
I will go at all risks―at all hazards.
生命を失う危険を冒して(生命を賭して)試みた
I made the attempt at the risk of my life―at the hazard of my life―at the peril of my life.
(生命などに)危険を及ぼす
to endanger life―imperil life―jeopardize life
そんな処置をしたなら国家に危険を及ぼさん
Such a measure would bring the Stats into danger.
危険を警戒する
(自分のなら)to look out for a danger―watch for dangers―(人のなら)―warn one of danger
僕は叫んで危険を警戒したけれど、もはや遅かった
I shouted to warn him of the danger, but it was too late.
危険な道を踏む
to tread a dangerous path
危険事業
a risky enterprise―a hazardous undertaking
病人は危険な容態だ
The invalid is in a critical state.
漁夫の(命がけの)危険な生活
the precarious life of a fisherman
危険人物
a dangerous character
危険分子
a disturbing element
危険思想
dangerous ideas―pernicious principles
危険運動
sedition
危険信号
a danger-signal

content:
きけん〔棄権〕
〈名〉Renunciation of a right; quitclaim:(=する) to renounce a right; to disclaim one's rights; to waive one's rights; to relinquish one's claim; to resign one's claim; to forego one's claim; to quitclaim (anything)

content.content: 権利を主張せずに棄権した
I waived my right, instead of insisting upon it.
正当にいけば彼が後を取るのだが棄権して弟を立てた
By rights, he was heir to the property, but he resigned his claim in favour of his younger brother.
投票を棄権する
to renounce one's right of voting―quitclaim one's vote―refrain from voting―abstain from voting

content:
きけん〔貴顕〕
〈名〉A man of eminent rank; a dignitary

content.content: 満堂の貴顕紳士諸君
Excellencies and gentlemen!

content:
きげん〔期限〕
〈名〉A period; a term

content.content: 期限を決める
to fix a term―set the term
期限を延ばす
to extend the term
期限を縮める
to reduce the term
期限満了
the expiration of a term
期限が満つる、期限が切れる
The term expires―The term runs out.
来年で租借の期限が切れる
The lease falls in next year.
支払期限
the term of payment
手形はいつ支払期限になるか
When does the note fall due?
来月が支払期限
The note is due next month.
手形は三カ月期限
The note is due in three months.
支払期限が来たら払う
I will pay when the note falls due.
支払期限が過ぎた
The note is overdue.
借金は来月が期限だ
The debt falls in next month.
在職期限
one's term of office
在職期限が満ちた
His term of office has expired―His term of office is out.
有効期限
the term of validity―the available period
この切符の有効期限は一週間
The ticket is available for a week.
この契約の有効期限は一年間
The contract holds good for a year.

content:
きげん〔機嫌〕
〈名〉
1. (=安否)one's state of health

content.content: ご機嫌を伺う
to inquire after one's health―(は原意、今の意味は)―pay one's respects to a superior―(芸人なら)―perform to the audience
御機嫌如何に候哉
I hope you are well―I trust you are in the enjoyment of good health.
(人に逢って)ご機嫌よう、ご機嫌はいかが
How do you do?―How are you?―Are you well?
さらばご機嫌よう
Farewell!―Adieu!―(陸路行く人になら)―I wish you a safe journey―A pleasant journey to you!―(海路行く人になら)―I wish you a happy voyage―A happy voyage to you!

content: 2. (=心持)humour; temper; mood

content.content: 機嫌が好い
He is in good humour―in a good temper―in a gracious mood.
たいそうご機嫌が好い
He is in the best of humour.
機嫌が悪い
He is in ill humour―out of humour―in a bad temper―moody―cross.
たいそうご機嫌が悪い
He is in the worst of humour―as cross as two sticks.
今日はご機嫌が悪いようだから、もっとご機嫌の好い時を見はからって頼んでみるがよい
He seems to be out of humour today. You had better ask him when he is in better humour.
彼は機嫌好く承諾した
He readily consented to my proposal.
人の機嫌を好くする
to put one in good humour
酒は機嫌を好くする
Wine exhilarates.
機嫌を悪くする
to get out of humour―look blue―(人のなら)―put one out (of humour)
親父は二百円払わせられて機嫌を悪くした
Father looked blue at having to pay 200 yen.
彼は些細なことで機嫌を悪くする
He is put out by trifles―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Trifles put him out of humour.
彼はこの話が出るとご機嫌が悪い
He is sore on the subject.
上機嫌だ
He is in high glee―full of glee―(酒に酔ってなら)―gloriously drunk―as drunk as a lord.
彼らは上機嫌で出て行った
They started in high glee.
彼は一杯機嫌でそう言ったのだ
He spoke under the influence of wine.
彼は機嫌上戸だ
He is merry over his cups.
殿はご機嫌斜めならず
My lord was gracious.
ご機嫌を損ずる
to hurt one's feeling―offend one
彼は主人のご機嫌を損じている
He is in disgrace with his master―in his master's black books.
機嫌が直る
to come round―brighten up
機嫌を直す
to restore one's good humour―make friends again
機嫌直しに一杯飲もう
Let us have a drink to make friends!
機嫌直して一杯飲んでくれ
Come round, and have a drink!
機嫌直して別れましょう
Let us part in amity!
ご機嫌をとる

to court a man―pay court to a man―try to please one's employer―keep in one's master's good graces―humour an invalid―conciliate one's enemy―soothe an angry man―pander to the tastes of the people―propitiate the gods
(彼は有力家だから)皆がご機嫌をとる
He is courted by everybody―Everybody pays court to him.
彼は主人のご機嫌をとる
He tries to please his master.
彼はしきりに人のご機嫌をとる
He is anxious to please everybody.
君はよくまああの主人のご機嫌がとれるね
How do you manage to keep in your master's good graces?
病人だから機嫌をとっておけ(言うにまかせよ)
Humour the invalid!
生徒のご機嫌とりをする先生がある
Some teachers pander to the students' caprices.
芸者は機嫌気づまをとる商売だ
The geisha must cater for people's caprices.
あの人は機嫌がとりにくい
He is hard to please―capricious.

content:
きげん〔紀元〕
〈名〉An era; an epoch

content.content: 新紀元を開く
to make a new era―make an epoch
新紀元を開く事件
an epoch-making event
英語研究史に新紀元を開く著述である
It is an epoch-making work in the study of English.
西暦紀元一千五百二十六年
the year 1926 of the Christian era―1926 A. D. (=Anno Domini)
西暦紀元前百二十年
120 B. C. (=before Christ)
神武天皇即位紀元二千五百八十五年
the year 2585 after the Accession of the Emperor Jinmu

content:
きげん〔起原〕
〈名〉Origin; rise; beginning; genesis:(=する) to originate (in something); to have its origin (in something); to take its rise (in something); to derive its origin (from something); to be derived (from something); to be traceable (to something)

content.content: 多くの日本語は仏教に起原する
Many Japanese expressions are derived from Buddhism―to be traced to Buddhism.
この習慣は何に起原するか
What does this custom originate in?―have its origin in?
言葉の起原を尋ねる
to trace a word to its origin―derive a word from its root
大和民族の起原は秘密におおわる
The origin of the Japanese people is veiled in mystery.
文明の起原地
the cradle of civilization

きげんかい〔機嫌買い〕
〈名〉A man of moods; a capricious person

きげんきずまをとる〔機嫌気褄を取る〕
〈熟語〉To cater for people's caprices; to minister to people's whims

きけんしそう〔危険思想〕
〈名〉Dangerous thoughts; dangerous ideas; pernicious principles; a seditious propaganda

きけんじんぶつ〔危険人物〕
〈名〉A dangerous character

きげんせつ〔紀元節〕
〈固名〉The Anniversary of the Accession of the Emperor jinmu; the National Era Day; the Empire Day

きけんぶんし〔危険分子〕
〈名〉A disturbing element

content:
きこ〔旗鼓〕
〈名〉Flag and drum

content.content: 旗鼓の間に相まみえる
to meet (as enemies) on the battlefield
旗鼓堂々と入城した
They made a triumphal entry with colours flying and band playing.

content:
きこ〔騎虎〕
〈名〉Circumstances

content.content: 騎虎の勢
force of circumstances
騎虎の勢で進む、騎虎の勢で止められぬ
I am driven by he force of circumstances.
騎虎の勢でやむを得ず競争をしたのだ
Circumstances obliged me to engage in a competition.

きご〔奇語〕
〈名〉A message:(=する) to send a message, send word (to some one)

content:
ぎこ〔擬古〕
〈名〉Archaism; classicism

content.content: 擬古文
an archaic style

content:
きこう〔奇功〕
〈名〉An eminent success

content.content: 奇功を奏す
to achieve a great success
この薬は奇功を奏す
The medicine does wonders―works wonders.

content:
きこう〔奇行〕
〈名〉Eccentric conduct

content.content: 氏はすこぶる奇行に富む
His life is a romance.
奇行家だ
He is an eccentric man―a man of eccentric virtues.

content:
きこう〔寄港〕
〈名〉Calling at a port:(=する) to call at a port; to stop at a port; to touch at a port; to put in at a port

content.content: 本船は香港に寄港ししかる後日本に赴く
We touch at Hongkong, and then proceed to Japan.
船は長崎に寄港して石炭を積んだ
The ship stopped at Nagasaki for coal.
修繕のため神戸に寄港した
We put in at Kobe for repairs.
寄港地
a port of call

content:
きこう〔寄稿〕
〈名〉A contribution:(=する) to contribute to (a magazine); to write for (a magazine)

content.content: 彼は方々の雑誌に寄稿する
He writes for several magazines.
寄稿家
a contributor

きこう〔帰港〕
〈名〉Return to port:(=する) to return to port; to put back to port

content:
きこう〔帰航〕
〈名〉The homeward voyage; the return passage:(=する) to make a homeward voyage; to make a return passage

content.content: 本船は帰航中であった
We were homeward bound.

content:
きこう〔気候〕
〈名〉
1. (=その地方の温度晴雨)climate

content.content: 日本は気候が温和だ
Japan has a mild climate.
日本の気候はお身体に合いますか
Does the climate of Japan agree with you?
気候に慣れる
to become seasoned to the climate―season to the climate―(人なら)―become acclimated―(動植物なら)―become acclimatized
気候学
climatology

content: 2. (=季節)season

content.content: 春は楽しい気候だ
Spring is a pleasant season.
気候の変わり目
the change of season
気候風
the monsoon

content: 3. (=天候)Weather

content.content: 気候が不順だ
The weather is unseasonable.
気候にあてられた
I am under the weather.

content:
きこう〔紀綱〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: こうき〔綱紀〕

きこう〔紀行〕
〈名〉An account of one's travels

きこう〔貴公〕
〈代名詞〉You:(=の) your

content:
きこう〔起工〕
〈名〉(土工なら)breaking ground:(建築なら) laying the corner-stone:(=する)(土工なら) to break ground:(築建なら) to lay the corner-stone:(船なら) to lay the keel; to lay down a ship:(鉄道なら) to lay down a railway

content.content: 建築はもう起工した
The corner-stone has been laid.
船はもう起工した
The keel has been laid―The ship has been laid down.
鉄道はもう起工した
The railway has been laid down―They have broken ground for the railway.
(建築の)起工式
the laying of the corner-stone

きこう〔起稿〕
〈名〉Drafting:(=する) to draft (an essay); to frame a draft

content:
きごう〔揮毫〕
〈名〉Writing; painting:(=する) to write; to paint

content.content: 揮毫のもとめに応ず
Request for writing (or painting) complied with.
肖像揮毫のもとめに応ず
Portraits painted.
彼は御前揮毫の栄を得た
He had the honour of writing (or painting) in the Imperial presence.

content:
きごう〔記号〕
〈名〉A sign; a mark; a symbol

content.content: H は水素の記号
“H” is the symbol of hydrogen.
H?O は何の記号か
What does “H?O” stand for?

ぎこう〔技巧〕
〈名〉Art; technical skill

content:
きこうし〔貴公子〕
〈名〉A young noble; a young lord; a young blood; a young sybarite:(集合的に言えば) gilded youth

content.content: 彼は貴公子ふうがある
He has the air of a lord.
君達のような貴公子がどうして貧の味を知るものか
How can you, gilded youth as you are, know what it is to be poor?
君達のような貴公子は美味に飽いているから何を食ってもうまくあるまい
You, sybarites with pampered tastes, can enjoy no delicacy.
彼は貴公子然としている
He is aristocratic-looking.

content:
きこえ〔聞え〕
〈名〉
1. (=名声)note; fame; renown; celebrity

content.content: 聞こえが高い
to be noted―famed―famous―renowned―celebrated
氏は賢明の聞こえ高し
He is renowned for his perspicacity.

content: 2. (=評判)reputation

content.content: そんなことをすると世間の聞こえが好くない
Such conduct would concern your reputation.

content: 3. (=他聞)publicity

content.content: このことは世間への聞こえをはばかる
The matter shuns publicity.

content:
きこえる〔聞える〕
〈自動〉
1. (=聞き得る)(人を主格とすれば)to hear; to overhear:(音を主格とすれば)to be heard; to be audible

content.content: はっきり聞える
I hear distinctly―It is distinctly audible.
もう聞こえない
I can not hear it―It is inaudible.
何が聞こえるか
What do you hear?
人声が聞こえる
I hear voices.
遠くて声が聞こえない
I can not hear his voice―His voice is not to be heard―His voice is inaudible―owing to the distance.
聞こえるようにそう言った
He said so loudly enough to be heard.
先生は声が低いから向こうのはしから聞こえない
He speaks in such a low voice that he can not be heard at the farther end of the room.
彼の声は暴風雨の音をしのいで聞こえた
His voice was heard above the storm.
あの雨の音が聞こえないか
Don't you hear the rain? ［注意］英語にてはこの場合に「音」を略す。
隣り座敷の話が聞こえた
I overheard a talk the next room.
僕の聞こえる所で彼はそう言った
He said so in my hearing.
呼んだら聞こえるところにおれ
Stay within hearing―within call―within earshot.
彼はもう呼んでも聞こえぬ
He is out of hearing―out of earshot―now.
足音が遠くて聞こえなくなった
His footsteps died away in the distance.
騒々しくて声が聞こえない
The voice is drowned in the noise―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The noise drowns the voice.
耳に聞こえる
to meet the ear―greet the ear―fall upon the ear
にわかに悲鳴が聞こえた
A shriek burst upon my ears.
君は耳が聞こえるか
Can you hear?
彼は年をとって耳が聞こえなくなった
He has grown old and deaf.

content: 2. (=響く)to sound; to ring

content.content: こういうと言い訳のように聞こえるが
This may sound like an excuse.
こういったら変に聞こえようがしかし事実だ
It may sound strange, but―Strange as it may sound,―it is true for all that.
この金貨の鳴り音は本物らしく聞こえる、偽物らしく聞こえる
The coin rings true―rings false.
あの人の声が本物らしく聞こえる、偽物らしく聞こえる
His voice rings true―rings false.

content: 3. (=知られる)to be known; to be noted; to be famed; to be famous; to be renowned; to be celebrated

content.content: 彼はなかなか聞こえた人だ
He is a famous man―a noted man―a man of note.
学者として聞こえている
He is renowned as a scholar―renowned for his scholarship.

content: 4. (=道理がある)to be reasonable

content.content: そりゃ聞こえませぬ伝兵衛さん
You are unreasonable, O Denbei San!

content:
きこく〔帰国〕
〈名〉Return to one's country; home-coming:(=する) to return to one's country; to go home; to come home

content.content: 彼は近々帰国のはず
(日本人なら)He is expected home shortly―(外国人なら)―He is to go home shortly.
帰国を命ぜらる
I am ordered home.
彼は帰国の途に就けり
He has started on his journey home―left for home.

content:
ぎごく〔疑獄〕
〈名〉
1. (=世上の疑念を起こす事件)a scandal

content.content: 疑獄を起こす
to raise a scandal
この疑獄には連類が多い
Many people are implicated in the scandal.
海軍疑獄事件
the navy scandal

content: 2. (=世間の疑問となる裁判事件)a criminal case (giving rise to public controversy)

content.content: 安政の大疑獄
the great case of Ansei

content:
きごこち〔着心地〕
〈名〉One's feeling in (a coat, etc.)

content.content: 新調の洋服は着心地はどうだ
How do you feel in your suit of clothes?
着心地の好い(悪い)着物
comfortable clothes―uncomfortable clothes

content:
きごころ〔気心〕
〈名〉Temper

content.content: 気心を知っているから扱い好い
I know how to deal with him, for I know his temper.
気心を知らないから扱いにくい
I do not know how to deal with him, for I do not know his temper.
気心の好くわかっている仲だ
We are tried friends.
気心のわからぬ男だ
He is an enigma―a sphinx.

content:
きこしめす〔聞召す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=お聞きになる)(the honorific for) to hear
2. (=めしあがる)(the honorific for) to eat or drink

content.content: 一杯きこしめす
to have a drink

content:
ぎごちない
〈形〉Stiff

content.content: 彼はぎごちないふうをしている
He has a stiff manner.

content:
きこつ〔気骨〕
〈名〉An indomitable spirit; spirit; soul

content.content: あれは気骨のある男だ

気骨の無い男だ
He has no spirit―no soul.

content:
きこなし〔着こなし〕
〈名〉How to wear (clothes) well

content.content: あの女は着物の着こなしが好い
She wears her clothes well.
芸者は着物の着こなしがうまい
Geisha girls are chic in their dress.

content:
きこなす〔着こなす〕
〈他動〉To manage to wear (clothes) well; to adapt oneself to (one's clothes)

content.content: 洋服を着こなす日本婦人は少ない
Few Japanese ladies know how to wear foreign clothes well―know how to adapt themselves to foreign clothes.

content:
きこのいきおい〔騎虎の勢〕
〈名〉Force of circumstances

content.content: 騎虎の勢で進む、騎虎の勢で止められぬ
One is driven by the force of circumstances.
騎虎の勢でやむを得ず競争をしたのだ
Circumstances obliged me to engage in competition.

きこり〔樵夫〕
〈名〉A wood-cutter; a woodman

content:
きこん〔既婚〕
〈形〉Married

content.content: 既婚の婦人
a married lady

content:
きこん〔気根〕
〈名〉
1. Mental energy; stamina; perseverance

content.content: 彼は気根が強い
He has indefatigable perseverance―dogged perseverance.
気根の弱い者にはできない商売だ
Those who have no stamina can not engage in this business.
気根が尽きた
My energy is exhausted.

content: 2. ［植物］An aerial root

きざ〔気障〕
〈形〉Disagreeable; intolerable; insufferable; personal

content.content: キザな奴だ
He is a disagreeable fellow―an Intolerable fellow.
キザなことを言う奴だ
He says disagreeable things―makes himself disagreeable.
赤いネクタイはキザだ
A red necktie is insufferable.
ステッキを持って歩くのはキザだ
To carry a stick looks personal.

きさい〔奇才〕
〈名〉(物)a remarkable talent; a wonderful talent:(人)a genius; a prodigy

きさい〔既済〕
〈名〉Paid(debt); settled(matter, etc.)

きさい〔記載〕
〈名〉A statement; a description; a report; a mention:(=する) to state; to describe; to report; to mention

きさい〔起債〕
〈名〉Flotation of a loan:(=する) to float a loan; to raise a loan

きざがき〔きざ柿〕
〈名〉A kind of persimmon which sweetens on the tree

content:
ギザギザ
〈名〉Jag; notches; indentation; serration

content.content: ギザギザの岩
jagged rock―jaggy rock
金銀貨幣の縁にギザギザがある
Gold and silver coins are milled.
ギザギザを付ける
to make notches on the edge―mill coins

きさく〔奇策〕
〈名〉A curious plan; a singular scheme

きさく〔気さく〕
〈形〉Candid; frank; frank-hearted; open-hearted

きさく〔詭策〕
〈名〉A trick, a ruse (to deceive the enemy)

content:
ぎさく〔偽作〕
〈名〉A spurious work

content.content: これは僕の作ではない偽作だ
The work has been fathered upon me.
偽作を作って人の銘を打つ
to father one's work upon another

content:
きざし〔兆し〕
〈名〉An omen; signs; indications; symptoms

content.content: 雪は豊年の兆し
Snow is the sign of a good harvest.
今年は干ばつの兆しがある
There are signs of a drought―indications of a drought―this year.
暴風雨の兆しは無い
There is no sign of a storm―no indication of a storm.
彼は結核の兆しがある
He has developed the symptoms of tuberculosis.

content:
きざす〔兆す〕
〈自動〉To augur (well or ill); to show signs of a (storm); to give indications of (a change); to develop the symptoms of (a disease)

content.content: 暴風雨が三日前から兆している
The sky has been showing signs of a storm for three days―The storm has been brewing for three days.
この病は一年前から兆している
The symptoms have been developing for a year―I have had symptoms of this discase for a year.

content:
きざす〔萌す〕
〈自動〉To germinate; to sprout

content.content: 若草がきざして来た
The grass is sprouting.

content:
きさま〔貴様〕
〈代名詞〉You (used in addressing an inferior)

content.content: 酒無くて
O wine!
何の貴様が
But for thee,
桜かな
Where would the cherry be?

content:
きざみあし〔刻み足〕

content.content: 刻み足に歩む

content.content: 野菜を刻む
to chop up vegetables
肉を刻む
to mince meat―hash meat
煙草を刻む
to cut tobacco
わらを刻む
to chaff straw
彼は金を刻む
He stints his money.
時計が時を刻む
A clock ticks.

content: 2. (=彫刻をする)to carve (an image); to engrave (one's name, etc.)

content.content: 仏像を刻む
to carve a Buddhist image
石に名を刻む
to engrave one's name on a stone―(第二構文は)―engrave a stone with one's name
この事は深く心に刻んでいる
The fact is deeply stamped on my mind―engraved into my soul.

〈名〉The second month(of the Lunar Calendar)

どうしてお気ざわりになったかどうも合点がいかぬ
I can not comprehend how I can have given him offence―offended him.

content:

〈名〉Return to one's lord's service:(=する) to return to one's lord's service

content.content: 帰参がかなう

〈名〉Counting from some date:(=する) to reckon from (some date); to count from (some date); to measure from (some point)

content.content: 利子は取引の日より起算す

起算日
the day from which a period is reckoned

the point from which the distance is measured

content:
きさんじ〔気散じ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: きばらし〔気晴らし〕

content:
きし〔岸〕
〈名〉(河の岸)the bank (of a river):(海、湖、河などの岸)the shore; the coast; the beach; the strand:(池などの岸)the border; the margin

content.content: 舟が岸に着く
A boat reaches the shore.
思いの岸に着く
to reach the goal of one's wishes
舟を岸に着ける
to put the boat ashore―beach the boat
船が岸に近寄る
The ship stands in for the shore.
船が岸を離れる
The ship clears the land―stands out to sea.
別荘は湖水の岸に立つ、河の岸に立つ
The villa stands on the shore of the lake―on the bank of the river.
波は岸を打つ
The waves beat the shore―beat against the beach.
波が岸に砕ける
The waves break on the beach.
小波が岸をなめる
The ripples lap the beach.
河が岸を洗う
A river washes the shore.
死骸が岸に打ち上がる
A body is washed ashore.
難破船が岸に打上げられる
A wrecked ship is cast ashore.

content.content: 旗幟を鮮明にする
to define one's position―(政党なら)―define the platform of the party

〈名〉Fainting from despair:(=する) to faint from despair

〈名〉
1. (=記述)description

content.content: 記事文
a descriptive composition
記事体
a descriptive style

content: 2. (=新聞の記事)an account; a statement; a paragraph; an item; news; reading matter

content.content: その記事は昨日の新聞に出ている
The account appeared in yesterday's paper.
その記事は間違っている
The statement is false.
今日の新聞にウラジオストック事件の記事が出ている
Today's paper contains an account of the Vladivostok affair.
その記事は誤聞につき取消しになった
The account was found to be erroneous, and withdrawn.
本文御掲載の上、記事お取消し被下度候

二面記事

police-court news―scandal news―human documents―the world, the flesh and the devil
目に見るような記事、絵に画いたような記事

記事欄
the news column

なにか面白い記事がありますか

content:

content.content: それでは儀式張っておかしい

儀式張らずに話そう

content:

We do not agree in temper―We are of contrary tempers.

きしゃ〔汽車〕
〈名〉A(railway)train

content.content: 汽車は一時間四十マイルの速力で走る

to ride in a train―(どこかへ行くためなら)―take a train―(乗り込むのなら)―get into a train―entrain―(米国では)―board a train
間違って汽車をのり違えた

There will be a railway there very soon―A railway will be laid［extended］ there very soon―The trains will be running there very soon―The place will soon be brought into railway communication.

きずぐち〔傷口〕
〈名〉(The opening of) a wound

content.content: 傷口がふさがった
The wound has closed.
傷口がまた開いた
The wound has opened again.
傷口を縫う
to sew up a wound
傷口を三針縫った
They put three stitches in the wound.

きずつく〔傷つく〕
〈自動〉(戦場でなら)to be wounded:(けがなら)to be injured

content:
きずつける〔傷つける〕
〈他動〉To wound; to injure

content.content: 人の自負心を傷つける
to wound one's pride
人の名に傷つける
to injure one's reputation―stab one's reputation―stab one in the back―cast a slur upon one's name―breathe upon one's fair name―calumnize one―defame one
傷つくべからざる人は無い
No man is invulnerable―Every man is vulnerable.

content:
きずな〔絆〕
〈名〉Bonds; ties; fetters; a yoke

content.content: 義理の絆
the bonds of gratitude
義理の絆にほだされる
to be bound (to some one) by gratitude
情愛の絆
the ties of affection
情愛の絆にほだされる
to be tied (to some one) by affection
恋の絆
the yoke of love
恋の絆にほだされる
to be fettered by the yoke of love

content:
きずもの〔疵物〕
〈名〉A flawed article:(硝子や瀬戸物なら)a cracked vessel:(馬なら)an unsound horse:(女なら)a ruined woman

content.content: 疵物だからお安く願っておきます
As the article has a flaw, you shall have it cheap.
こんな疵物を売りつけられた
I had such an unsound article imposed upon me.
女は一度操を破ると一生の疵物だ
If a woman once loses her chastity, she is ruined for life.
女を疵物にする
to ruin a girl
お陰で娘は疵物になりました
You have ruined my daughter.
疵物の長持ち
“A cracked vessel ofter lasts the longest”.

content:
きする〔期する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=予期する)to expect (a result); to hope for (success); to look for (failure); to count on (success); to be prepared for (failure); to be sure of (victory); to be certain of (victory); to be confident of (victory)

content.content: 皆僕の成功を期している
Everybody hopes I shall succeed―expects me to succeed.
皆彼の失敗を期している
Everybody fears he will fail―expects him to fail.
君の成功は期して待つべし
I am sure of your success―I am certain of your success―I am confident of your success―You are sure to succeed―You are certain to succeed―You are bound to succeed.
必勝を期す
to be sure of victory―be certain of victory―be confident of victory
ドイツ皇帝は必勝を期したのが悪かった
The kaiser ought not to have been so sure of victory―He was over-confident of victory, which he ought not to have been.
人は必勝を期すべからず
“It is not in mortals to command success.”
英国は終局の勝利を期しておった
England was sure of ultimate victory.
かねて期したる如く事業は失敗に帰した
As was expected,―According to expectation,―According to our expectations,―the undertaking has ended in a failure.
かねてこのことあるを期しておった
I was prepared for this.
安心して成功を期す
I look for success with confidence―I am confident of success.
生還は期するところにあらず
I do not hope to live to see my native land.
国家の改善は短日月を期すべからず
A national reform is not to be effected in a day.
命旦夕を期せず
His life hangs by a thread.
期せずして
unexpectedly―accidentally―by accident―by chance
期せずして逢った
I met him by chance.
期せずして人命を救った
I saved a man's life by chance―I chanced to save a man's life―I happened to save a man's life.

content: 2. (=約す)to promise (to do something)

content.content: 二人は再会を期して別れた
They parted, promising to meet again.

content: 3. (=定める)to fix (the date―upon a day); to appoint (the time)

content.content: 再会の日を期す
to appoint a day for meeting again
日を期して再会した
We met again on the appointed day.
近日を期す
to fix an early date

content: 4. (=決心する)to determine (to do something)

content.content: 必ず志を遂げることを心に期した
I determined to accomplish my purpose.

content:
きする〔帰する〕
〈自動〉(=帰る、なる、陥る)to be reduced to (ashes); to resolve itself Into (something); to become (something); to come to (the same thing); to fall to (the ground); to fall into(one's hands); to end in (a failure); to rest with (one); to remain with (one); to lie at one's door

content.content: 家は灰燼に帰した
The house was reduced to ashes.
全市鳥有に帰す
The whole city was reduced to ashes―razed to the ground.
失敗に帰す
to end in a failure―result in a failure―issue in a failure―eventuate in a failure―prove a failure―prove abortive―end in smoke―to be doomed to failure
事業は失敗に帰した
The project ended in a failure.
僕の試みは失敗に帰した
My attempt proved abortive.
遠征は失敗に帰した
The expedition was doomed to failure.
水泡に帰す
to come to naught―go for nothing
多年の労水泡に帰す
Years of labour has come to naught.
画餅に帰す
to go to the ground―fall to the ground―fall through―drop through―be dashed to earth
計画は画餅に帰した
The project has fallen through―fallen to the ground.
開戦のためにせっかくの計画が画餅に帰した
The war has dashed my scheme (to earth).
栄耀栄華の生涯も帰するは死出の旅路のみ
“The paths of glory lead but to the grave.”
手に帰す
to fall into one's hands
旅順我が手に帰す
Port Arthur fell into our hands.
満洲はロシアの手に帰するところであった
Manchuria would have fallen into the hands of Russia.
天下は幕府の掌中に帰した
The Empire fell into the hands of the Shogunate.
兵権武門に帰す
Military power fell into the hands of military families.
武芸は武士の独占に帰す
The use of arms became the monopoly of the samurai.
勝利我れに帰す
The victory remained with us―rested with us.
君の失敗は自家に帰す
Your failure lies at your own door.→『きするところ〔帰する処〕』

content: 〈他動〉(=帰因する)to attribute (one's success to luck); to ascribe (a work to its author); to impute (a crime to one); to assign (anything to its cause); to refer (anything to its cause); to put down, set down (one's success to luck); to lay (a fault) to one's charge; to lay (a fault) at one's door; to credit (one with an action)

content.content: 世人は彼の成功を僥倖に帰す
People attribute his success to luck.
人は彼の失敗を無能に帰す
People attribute his failure to his incompetence.
日本の大将は戦勝を天皇の御稜威{みいづ}に帰す
The Japanese commanders attribute their victories to the glorious virtue of the Emperor.
神に全知全能の徳を帰す
Omniscience and omnipotence are attributed to God.
この詩は西郷隆盛に帰せらる
The poem is ascribed to the pen of Saigo Takamori.
罪を僕に帰するのは間違っている
You are wrong in imputing the crime to me―laying the fault to my charge―laying the fault at my door.
火薬の発明は支那人に帰せらる
The invention of gunpowder is attributed to the Chinese―The Chinese are credited with the invention of gunpowder.
たいがいの病は細菌の作用に帰せられている
Most diseases are assigned to―referred to the action of bacilli.

content:
きする〔記する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=書き記す)to write down, note down, take down, put down (a name); to jot down (an incident); to take notes of (a lecture)
2. (=心に記す)to remember; to keep (a fact) in mind; to bear (a promise) in mind

content.content: 恨まず記せず
Forgive and forget!

content:
ぎする〔擬する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=真似る) to imitate, copy after (a model)

content.content: 金閣寺に擬して造った茶亭
The pavilion was built in imitation of―after the model of―the Kinkaku.

content: 2. (=譬える)to compare, liken (one thing to another)

content.content: 人生を航海に擬す
Life is likened to a voyage―compared to a voyage.

content: 3. (=仮定する) to suppose; to assume

content.content: 南軍を侵入軍に擬す
The southern army is supposed to be the invading army.
田中氏は外務大臣に擬せらる
Mr. Tanaka is assumed to be Foreign Minister.
後任に擬す
to propose some one to take one's place
人に拳銃を擬す
to present a pistol at one

content:
ぎする〔議する〕
〈他動〉To discuss (a matter); to debate on (a question); to deliberate on (some affair)

content.content: 問題を議す
to discuss a question―debate on a question
国事を議事す
to deliberate on the affairs of state

ぎする〔艤する〕
〈他動〉To equip, fit out (a ship for a voyage)

content:
きするところ〔帰する処〕
〈副〉In the end; in the issue; in the final analysis; after all; in short

content.content: 帰するところ皆同じことだ
They all come to the same thing after all.
帰するところこの問題は黄白いずれか世界を支配するようになるかということになる
In the final analysis, the question resolves itself into this: Which will rule the world, yellow or white?
帰するところ実力が勝つ
Real ability wins in the end.
帰するところ金が欲しいのだろう
In short, you want money.

content:
きせい〔寄生〕
〈名〉Parasitism:(=の) parasitic:(=する) to be a parasite to (anything); to be parasitic on (anything)

content.content: 寄生物、寄生虫
a parasite
寄生植物
a parasitic plant―an epiphyte

content:
きせい〔既成〕
〈形〉Completed; accomplished

content.content: 既成工事
completed works
既成の事実
an accomplished fact―a fait accompli

content:
きせい〔期成〕
〈名〉Resolution to carry out a design:(=する) to resolve to carry out a design

content.content: 期成同盟会
a union to carry out a design
吾人は期成同盟会を起して意志の貫徹を期した
We formed a union to carry through our design.

content:
きせい〔帰省〕
〈名〉Return home (to one's parents); home-coming:(=する) to return home (to one's parents); to go home; to come home

content.content: 試験がすんでから帰省した
The examination over, I went home to see my parents.
生徒は休暇で帰省中
The boys are home for the holidays.
彼は賜暇帰省中
He is home on leave.
一週間の賜暇で帰省中
He is home on a week's leave of absence.
僕は五年帰省しない
I have not been home for five years.
五年ぶりで帰省した
I am home after a five years' absence.

content:
きせい〔気勢〕
〈名〉Spirit

content.content: 気勢を示す
to show one's spirit
気勢を添える
to inspirit a man(to do something)
気勢をそぐ
to dispirit a man
支那では排日の気勢が高まってきた
In China, the anti-Japanese spirit is running high.

きせい〔祈誓〕
〈名〉A vow:(=する) to vow, make a vow (to a deity)

content:
きせい〔稀世〕
〈形〉Rare; uncommon; extraordinary

content.content: 彼は稀世の英雄だ
He is no common hero.
稀世の才子だ
He is a genius.

content:
ぎせい〔犠牲〕
〈名〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. A sacrifice (to a deity)

content.content: 神前に人を犠牲に供える(人身御供)
to offer a human sacrifice to the gods
彼は政略の犠牲となった
He became the sacrifice of―fell a sacrifice to―a policy.
身を犠牲に供す
to sacrifice oneself (for some noble object)
甲を乙の犠牲に供す
to sacrifice one thing to another―sacrifice one thing on the altar of another
一人を犠牲に供して多くの人を助ける
to sacrifice one to many―sacrifice one on the altar of many
政治家は往々便宜のために正義を犠牲にする
A politician will sacrifice justice to expediency―sacrifice justice on the altar of expediency.
(文章の)意味を明瞭にするために美を犠牲にする
to sacrifice beauty to clearness
美を犠牲にして意味を明瞭にする
to make the meaning clear at the sacrifice of beauty
彼は成功するために健康を犠牲にした
He sacrificed his health on the altar of success.
健康を犠牲にして成功した
He succeeded at the sacrifice of his health.
主義のために利益を犠牲にする
to sacrifice one's interests to one's principles
利益を犠牲にして主義を立てる
to uphold one's principles at the sacrifice of one's interests
君は利益を犠牲にしても得るところは無い
You will gain nothing by the sacrifice of your interests.
勝利を得るには多少の人命を犠牲にしなけりゃならぬ
We must sacrifice some lives in order to gain a victory.
多少の人命を犠牲にしなけりゃ勝利は得られぬ
A victory can be gained only at the sacrifice of some lives―only by sacrifice of life.
多大の犠牲を払って得た(割に合わぬ)勝利だ
It was a Pyrrhic victory―a Cadmean victory.

content: 2. A price (for victory)

content.content: 勝利を得るためにはどんな犠牲をも払う
We will pay any price for victory.
どんな犠牲を払っても勝たなければならぬ
We must win the day at any price.
この勝利は多大の犠牲を払って得た勝利だ
The victory was dearly bought.
彼は健康を犠牲にして成功した
He succeeded at the price of his health.
彼女は生命を犠牲にして(命を捨てて)子どもを助けた
She saved the child at the price of her life.
自由を犠牲にして平和を買う国民は奴隷国民だ
A nation of slaves will purchase peace at the price of liberty.
いかなる犠牲を払っても平和(不名誉の平和)
peace at any price

content: 3. Cost

content.content: 良心を犠牲にして(悪いことをして)富貴になる者がある
Some people acquire wealth at the cost of a clear conscience.
また名誉を犠牲にして(不正なことをして)立身する者がある
Others rise in the world at the cost of honour.
彼は健康を犠牲にして成功したのだ
He has succeeded at the cost of his health.
彼は成功するために健康を犠牲にしている
His success cost him his health.
この発明のために発明者が生命を犠牲にした
The invention cost the inventor his life.
職務怠慢のために彼は地位を犠牲にした
Neglect of duty cost him his position.

content: 4. Expense

content.content: 自国語を犠牲にして英語を学んだ
I learned my English at the expense of my Japanese.
(文章)の美を犠牲にして意味を明瞭にする
to make the meaning clearer at the expense of beauty
人を犠牲にして(人に迷惑をかけて)我が身の明りを立てるのは男らくしない
It is not manly to clear oneself at another's expense.
人を犠牲にして面白がって笑っていあがる
They are making merry at my expense.

content: 5. A victim (to a scheme)

content.content: 彼は悪計の犠牲となった(悪計に掛かった)
He became the victim of―fell a victim to―an evil scheme.
人を犠牲にする(欺く)
to make a victim of a man―victimize a man
犠牲にされる
to be made a victim of―be victimized

content: 6. (=そのために死ぬ犠牲) a martyr (to some cause)

content.content: 彼は科学の犠牲となった
He died a martyr to science.

content: 7. (=人に欺かれる犠牲) dupe

content.content: 人を犠牲にする(欺く)
to dupe a man

content: 8. (=人の罪を負わせられる犠牲) a scapegoat

content.content: 彼は(自分の責任をのがれるために)人を犠牲にした
He made a scapegoat of another in order to evade his own responsibility.

ぎせいご〔擬声語〕
〈名〉An onomatopoeia

content:
きせき〔奇蹟〕
〈名〉A miracle:(=の) miraculous

content.content: 奇蹟を行う
to work a miracle
キリストは奇蹟を行ったと聖書に書いてある
The Bible says that Christ wrought miracles.
彼が助かったのは奇跡だ
His escape is a miracle―He has escaped by a miracle.
彼が助かったのはまったく奇蹟だ
His escape is nothing short of a miracle.
彼が助かったのはほとんど奇蹟のようだ
His escape is little short of a miracle―His escape borders on the miraculous.
彼が助かったのは奇蹟のようだ
He has had a miraculous escape.
奇蹟でもなければとても助かるものではなかった
Nothing short of a miracle could have saved him.

content:
きせき〔軌跡〕
〈名〉A locus

content.content: 軌跡を求む
to find a locus

content:
きせき〔鬼籍〕
〈名〉A death register

content.content: 鬼籍に入る
to join the majority―die

content:
きせつ〔既設〕
〈形〉Established

content.content: 既設線
Lines in operation.

content:
きせつ〔気節〕
〈名〉A noble spirit; noble sentiment

content.content: 気節を守る
to keep up noble spirit

content:
きせつ〔季節〕
〈名〉A season; a time of the year

content.content: 春は一年中で一番楽しい季節だ
Spring is the pleasantest season of the year.
じきに花の季節になる
It will soon be the cherry season.
季節季節の行事を欠かさないのが江戸っ子だ
The Tokyo people never miss the pleasures of the season.
季節の変わり目
a change of season
今は季節の変わり目だ
The season is changing.
この病いは季節の変わり目に発する
The disease breaks out at the change of season.
この天候は季節違いだ
The weather is unseasonable.
この果物は季節はずれだ
The fruit is out of season.
この品は季節後れだ
These goods are behind the season.
季節風
the monsoon

content:
きぜつ〔気絶〕
〈名〉Fainting; a swoon:(=する) to faint; to swoon; to fall into a swoon; to fall senseless; to fall insensible; to fall unconscious; to lose one's consciousness; to lose one's senses; to be stunned

content.content: 彼は気絶して倒れた
He fell senseless on the ground.
打たれて気絶した
He was stunned by the blow―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The blow stunned him.
彼女は悲報に接してすんでのことに気絶した
She nearly fainted at the news.
びっくりして気絶する
to faint from fright

ぎぜつ〔義絶〕
〈名〉Severance of friendship:(=する) to sever friendship(with one); to forbid (one) the house

content:
きせる〔煙管〕
〈名〉
1. A (tobacco-) pipe

content.content: きせるをくわえている
He has a pipe in his mouth.
きせるをくわえて立っている
He is standing with a pipe in his mouth―pipe in mouth.
きせるをつめる
to fill a pipe (with tobacco)―replenish a pipe (with tobacco)
きせるに火をつける
to light a pipe
きせるをたたく
to knock the ashes out of a pipe
このきせるはよく通る
This pipe draws well.
このきせるは通らぬ
This pipe does not draw.
きせるの雁首
the bowl of a pipe
きせるの吸口
the mouthpiece of a pipe
きせるのらう
the bamboo-stem of a pipe

content:
きせる〔着せる〕
〈他動〉To dress (one in clothes); to clothe (one)

content.content: 人に着物を着せる
to dress one in clothes―clothe one
彼らに食わして着せておく
I feed them and clothe them―I keep them back and belly.
お母さんは子どもに着物を着せている
The mother is dressing the child.
外套を着せてくれ給え
Please help me on with my overcoat.
彼女に着物を一枚着せてやった
I have made her a new gown―bought her a new gown.
鬼に法衣を着せたよう
He is a wolf in sheep's clothing.
歯に衣を着せる
to mince matters

content:
きせる〔被せる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=メッキする)to gild; to plate; to coat

content.content: 時計に金をきせる
to plate a watch with gold
金きせ
gold-plating
金きせ時計
a gold-plated watch
指環に薄く金をきせる
to wash a ring with gold
銅に錫をきせる
to coat copper with tin
雑木に桐などをきせる
to veneer inferior wood with (paulownia, etc.)
箱は桐がきせてある
The box is veneered with paulownia.
罪をきせる
to lay the blame on one―impute the crime to one―charge the guilt on one―charge one with a crime―lay a fault to one's charge―lay a fault at one's door
彼に罪をきせるのは可哀相だ
It is cruel to lay the blame on him.
僕は大罪をきせられた
I am charged with a great crime―A great crime is imputed to me.
君は失敗の罪をきせられるぞ
They will lay the failure to your charge―lay the failure at your door.
ぬれぎぬをきせる
to accuse one falsely
ぬれぎぬを被せられた
I am falsely accused.
汚名をきせる
to fasten a stigma upon one
詐欺師の汚名をきせる
to stigmatize one as a swindler―brand one as a swindler
彼は泥棒の汚名をきせられた
He was stigmatized as a thief―branded as a thief.
恩にきせる
to assume a patronizing air
彼は少しのことを恩にきせる
He will come the benefactor over you for a trifle.

content:
きぜわしい〔気急しい〕
〈形〉Restless; fidgety; fussy

content.content: 気ぜわしい老人だ
He is a fussy old man.
君はいつも気ぜわしいさまだ
You seem to be always in a fidget.
試験が来ると気ぜわしい
An examination makes one restless.

content:
きせん〔機先〕
〈名〉Forestalling

content.content: 機先を制す
to forestall the enemy―anticipate an attack―get the start of one's rival―steal a march upon the enemy―be beforehand with the enemy
日本はロシアの機先を制した
Japan forestalled Russia―got the start of Russia.
彼に機先を制せられた
He has got the start of me―He has been beforehand with me―He has stolen a march upon me.

きせん〔帰線〕
〈名〉The return circuit

content:
きせん〔汽船〕
〈名〉A steamer; a steamship; a steamboat; a steam-vessel

content.content: 汽船が走る
A steamship runs.
汽船で行く
I am going by steamer.
汽船に乗る
to ride in a steamer―(乗り込むのなら)―go on board a steamer―(便乗するのなら)―take passage in (or on) a steamer
あの汽船で来た
I came in (or on) that steamer.
乗客汽船
a passenger-boat
貨物船
a cargo-boat―a freighter
定期汽船
a liner
不定期貨物汽船
an ocean tramp
遠洋通いの汽船
an ocean liner
内地通いの汽船
a coasting steamer
日本郵船会社の定期汽船
an N. Y. K. liner
汽船宿
a shipping agency―(旅館なら)―a seaside hotel

content:
きせん〔貴賤〕
〈名〉(事)rank:(人)high and low; great and small; gentle and simple; all classes of people

content.content: 貴賤を論せず
irrespective of rank
貴賤上下の別無く
without distinction of rank or standing
貴賤老若の別無くこの日を祝う
High and low, young and old, celebrate this day.
彼は貴賤の事情に通じている
He is familiar with the conditions of all classes.
法律の日には貴賤の別無し
All men are equal in the eyes of the law.

content:
きぜん〔毅然〕
〈副〉Bravely; heroically; with fortitude

content.content: 毅然たる大丈夫
a heroic man
彼は毅然として不幸に堪えている
He bears his misfortune with fortitude.

content:
きぜん〔喟然〕
〈副〉With a sigh

content.content: 喟然として嘆息する
to heave a deep sigh

〈名〉A sham fight

〈名〉Hypocrisy; cant:(=の) hypocritical

content:
ぎぜん〔巍然〕
〈副〉Majestically

content.content: 建物は巍然として立つ
The building towers up majestically―towers above the neighbouring houses.
巍然として雲表にそびゆる山岳
The majestic heights rise above the clouds.
巍然として頭角を顕わす
to cut a conspicuous figure―cut a prominent figure

ぎぜんしゃ〔偽善者〕
〈名〉A hypocrite

content:
きそ〔基礎〕
〈名〉The foundation; the basis; the base; the substructure; the groundwork; the grounds

content.content: 基礎を置く
to lay the foundation
彼はこのとき大成の基礎を置いた
He then laid the foundation of his future greatness―laid the corner-stone of his present greatness.
宗教を基礎とせる道徳
morality on a religious foundation―morality on a religion
信仰の基礎
grounds of belief
彼は信用の基礎が堅い(確固たる基礎を有す)
His credit is established on a firm basis.
この商売は基礎が固い
The business is conducted on a sound basis.
国の基礎が固い
The Empire is founded on a solid basis―built on a rock.
国の基礎を動かす
to shake the foundation of the Empire
国の基礎を危うする
to undermine the foundation of the Empire
基礎を固める、基礎を強固にする
to solidify the foundation―place anything on a solid basis
今の社長が来てから会社の基礎が強固になった
The present president has placed the company on a solid basis.
この商売は三年たてば基礎ができる
The business will be on a firm basis in three years.
知識の基礎は経験なり
Knowledge rests on experience.

content:
きそ〔起訴〕
〈名〉(民事は)litigation; legal proceedings:(刑事は)prosecution; indictment:(=する) to litigate (a claim); to bring an action (against one); to institute a suit (against one); to institute legal proceedings (against one); to proceed (against one); to go law (with one); to sue (for a debt); to prosecute (for a debt):(検事が起訴する)to prosecute (one for a crime); to indict (one for a crime); to charge (one with a crime); to accuse (one of a crime)

content.content: 損害賠償を起訴する
to bring an action for damages―institute a suit for damages―sue for damages―prosecute for damages
彼は殺人罪で起訴された
He was prosecuted for manslaughter―indicted for manslaughter―charged with manslaughter―accused of manslaughter.
事件は証拠不充分のため不起訴になった
The case was dropped for want of sufficient evidence.

content.content: きぞう〔寄贈〕

content:
きそう〔汽走〕
〈名〉Steaming:(=する) to steam

content.content: 船は緩慢な速力で汽走しておった
The ship was under easy steam.

content:
きそう〔起草〕
〈名〉Drafting:(=する) to draft; to draw up

content.content: 法案を起草する
to draft a bill
報告書を起草する
to draw up a report
帝国憲法は伊藤公の起草にかかる
The Imperial Constitution was drafted by Prince Ito.

content:
きそう〔競う〕
〈他動〉To rival (some one in power); to emulate(each other in doing something); to compete (with some one for custom); to contend (with some one for a prize); to contest (something); to cope with (some one in wealth); to vie with (some one in splendour); to strive with (some one in doing something); to struggle with (some one for something); to compare with (someone in scholarship) ; to scramble for (seats, etc.)

content.content: 彼らは王侯と栄華を競う
They vie with royalty in splendour―cope with royalty in splendour.
若武者は互いに手柄を競った
The young warriors emulated each other in deeds of arms.
商人は得意を競う
Tradesmen compete for custom.
交戦国は目的物を競う
The belligerents contend for the prize.
選挙を競う
to contest an election
彼と学力を競う者は無い
No one can compare with him in ability.
百花色を競うて咲く
The flowers rival each other in beauty―vie with each other in beauty.
人々は競って募集に応じた
People strove with one another in answering the advertisement―People eagerly answered the advertisement.
人々は競って株を買った
People strove with one another in buying the shares―People eagerly bought the shares.

content:
きぞう〔寄贈〕
〈名〉A presentation; a contribution; a donation:(=する) to present, contribute, donate, present (anything to an institution)

content.content: 寄贈品
a donation―a gift
寄贈品
the donor

content:
ぎそう〔艤装〕
〈名〉Equipment (of a ship):(=する) to equip, fit out (a ship for a voyage)

content.content: 船は目下艤装中
The ship is fitting out―being equipped―under equipment.
船の艤装を解く
to dismantle a ship

content:
ぎぞう〔偽造〕
〈名〉Forgery; fabrication:(=する) to gorge, fabricate (a document):(=の) forged; fabricated (document)

content.content: 私書偽造
forgery of a private document
偽造者
a forger
偽造物
a forgery
偽造罪
forgery

ぎそうじゅつ〔擬装術〕
〈名〉Camouflage

content:
きそく〔気息〕
〈名〉Breath; breathing

content.content: 気息奄々{えんえん}
His breathing is laboured―He is gasping for breath―He is at his last gasp.
会社は気息奄々の姿である
The company is at its last gasp.
人の気息をうかがう
to hang on one's smiles

content:
きそく〔規則〕
〈名〉A rule; a regulation

content.content: 規則を立てる、規則を定める規則を設ける
to make a rule―lay down a rule―establish regulations
語学研究に規則を立てる
to reduce language-study to rule―reduce language-study to system
規則を編む
to frame the rules
規則を守る
to observe the rules
規則に従う
to act upon a rule―comply with the regulations
何事もご規則通り
Everything has been done according to rule―in accordance with the regulations―The regulations have been complied with.
規則による
to go by rule
あの人は何をするにも規則攻めだ
He does everything by rule―He is a formalist.
規則に拘泥する
to adhere to a rule
あの人は規則に拘泥する、規則がやかましい
He is a stickler for regulations.
規則を破る、規則を犯す、規則に触れる、規則に違反する
to break the rule―violate the rule―offend against the rule
この規則に違反すべからず
This rule must not be violated.
この規則を破ると十円の罰金だ
The violation of this regulation is punishable with a fine of 10 yen.
規則違反
violation of a regulation―breach of rule
規則にはずれる
to be against rule
そんな規則にはずれたことはできない
It would be against rule to do such a thing.
規則を実行する
to reduce a rule to practice
規則を施行する
to enforce a regulation
右規則は発布当日より施行す
The above regulations come into force on the day of their issue.
規則を改正する
to revise the regulations
規則を変更する
to after the regulations
規則を応用する
to apply a rule (to a case)
規則に合わせる
to conform anything to the rule
規則が厳重だ
The rules are stringent.
規則でしばる
to restrain one by rule
本件は規則第三条に該当す
The case falls under Rule Ⅲ―comes under Rule Ⅲ.
規則の範囲内で何事もしなければならぬ
Everything must be done within the rules.
一定不動の規則
a hard and fast rule
この事には一定不動の規則は無い
There is no hard and fast rule regarding this matter.
規則あれば例外あり
Every rule has its exceptions―There is no rule without its exceptions―There are exceptions to every rule.
規則だった、規則正しい
regular―methodical―systematic
規則動詞
a regular verb
規則書
a prospectus

content:
きそく〔驥足〕
〈名〉Genius; talent; ability

content.content: 驥足を伸ばす
to give scope to one's ability―give play to ability―call one's genius into play
驥足を伸ばし得る事業を選べ
Choose some work which will give scope to your ability.
彼は驥足を伸ばす機会を求めている
He seeks scope for his talents.
彼の今の地位では驥足を伸ばすことができぬ
His present position does not call his genius into play.

content:

〈名〉(の社会)the nobility; the aristocracy:(の一人)a noble; a nobleman; a peer; an aristocrat; a lord:(=の) noble; aristocratic; titled

content.content: 彼は貴族に列せられた
He was raised to the peerage―created a peer―ennobled.
あれで貴族のはしくれだ
He is a fag-end of nobility.
貴族的
aristocratic
貴族政治
aristocracy
貴族崇拝
lordolatory―snobbery―tuft-hunting
貴族崇拝家
a lordolater―a snob―a tuft-hunter

〈名〉A chivalrous robber; a Robin Hood

the president of the House of Peers

〈名〉A prospectus

content:

〈形〉Regular; methodical; systematic

content.content: あれは規則正しい人だ
He is a man of regular, habits―a methodical man.

きそくだった〔規則立った〕
〈形〉Regular; methodical; systematic

〈名〉The first wearing (of a suit):(=する) to wear (a new suit) for the first time

〈名〉Injury; damage:(=する) to injure; to damage

content.content: 人の名誉を毀損する
to injure one's reputation―cast a slur on one's good name―cast an aspersion on one's honour―take away one's character―defame one's character
そんな風説が立つと君の名誉を毀損する
Such rumours will be injurious to your reputation.
名誉毀損
defamation―libel

content:
きた〔北〕
〈名〉The north:(=の) north; northern; northerly

content.content: 磁石は北を指す
The magnetic needle points to the north.
シベリアはアジアの北に在り
Siberia is In the north of Asia.
シベリアは満洲の北に在り
Siberia lies on the north of Manchuria.
仙台は東京の北に在り
Sendai lies (to the)north of Tokyo.
北に当たる
to lie to the north―(海上では)―bear north
満洲は北はシベリアに境す
Manchuria borders on Siberia on the north.
北は海に面す
to face the sea on the north
北の方
northward
はるか北の方に島がある
There is an island far to the northward.
北の方へ行く
to go north
北の方へ行けば行くほど寒くなる
The farther south you go, the colder it becomes.
北向き
northern aspect
家は北向きだから冬は寒い
The house has a northern aspect―The house looks toward the north―and is cold in winter.
北側に
on the north side(of the street)
北風
the north wind―a northerly wind
北アメリカ
North America.
北半球
the northern hemisphere

content:
きたい〔危殆〕
〈名〉Danger; peril

content.content: 彼は危殆に陥っている

危殆に頻している
He is in imminent danger.
危殆を脱する

content:
きたい〔奇態〕
〈形〉Strange; curious; singular; odd; queer; wonderful; marvelous; miraculous

content.content: 君が知らないとは奇態だ
It is strange―odd―that you should not know it.
あのような女がこんな男の妻になっているのは奇態だと思った
I thought it strange―It struck me as strange―that such a woman should have married such a man.
奇態なことには少しもけがをしない
Strange to say,―Curious to relate, Wonderful to tell,―For a wonder,―Oddly enough,―he was not in the least injured.
奇態なこともあればあるものだ
It is wonderful―marvellous―prodigious―nothing short of a miracle.

content:
きたい〔期待〕
〈名〉Expectation; hope:(=する) to expect (anything from or of a man); to hope for (success); to look for (failure); to bargain for (anything); to be prepared for (failure); to count on (anything); to lay one's account with (anything)

content.content: 皆君の成功を期待している
Everybody hopes you will succees―Everybody expects you to succeed.
君は大いに期待されている
Much is expected of you.
僕にあまり期待しては困る、失望すると悪いから
You must not expect too much of me, lest you should be disappointed.
こんなに成功しようとは期待しなかった
I did not look for such a success.
失敗は期待しておった
I was prepared for failure.
これは期待と違う
I did not bargain for this.
もっと利益があるものと期待しておった
I counted on a larger profit―I laid my account with a larger profit.
彼は騰貴を期待して買い込んだ
He laid in a large stock in expectation of a rise.
期待に反して彼は失敗した
Contrary to expectation,―Contrary to my expectations,―he has failed.
いま一人の方は期待以上に成功した
The other man has succeeded beyond expectation―beyond my expectations.
期待にそう、期待に応ずる
to answer one's expectations―fulfil one's expectations―come up to one's expectations
彼の成功は期待にそわぬ
His success does not come up to my expectations―His success falls short of my expectations.
期待に背く
to disappoint one's hopes
期待に背かぬように頼む
See that you do not disappoint me.
期待に背くと悪いから僕にあまり期待するな
You must not expect too much of me, lest I should disappoint you.

〈名〉The chassis (of an aeroplane)

〈名〉Rejoining one's regiment:(=する) to rejoin one's regiment

content:

content.content: 気体化する

content:

〈形〉Rare; singular

content.content: 稀代の才子だ
He is gifted with rare talents.

content.content: きたい〔稀代〕

content:
ぎだい〔議題〕
〈名〉(これから議せんとすること)a subject for discussion:(すでに議題となったこと)the subject of discussion; the question on the tapis

content.content: 議題は(?)
What is the subject of discussion?―the question on the tapis?
これが議題に上がる
It will be a subject for discussion―It will come up for discussion―come on the tapis.
これを議題にする
We shall make it a subject for discussion―bring it up for discussion―bring it on the tapis.

content:
きたえ〔鍛え〕
〈名〉
1. (=金属を焼いて錬ること)forging; temper:(=る) to forge; to temper; to work

content.content: 鉄を鍛える
to forge iron―work iron―temper steel
鉄を鍛え合わせる

刀を鍛える
to forge a sword―(湯加減するの意味なら)―temper a sword
原料を鍛え上げる
to work up materials

content: 2. (=鍛錬)discipline; training; drill; practice:(=る) to discipline, school (the mind); to practise, drill (a student in English); to train (the body or mind); to inure (oneself to hardships); to harden (oneself to fatigue, etc.)

content.content: 精神を鍛える
to discipline one's mind―school one's mind
身体を鍛える
to harden one's body
疲労に堪えるように身体を鍛える
to harden oneself to fatigue
艱難に堪えるように身を鍛える
to inure oneself to hardships
身体を鍛え上げる
to build up one's constitution
身心を鍛える
to train the body and mind
(端艇競漕などに)身体を鍛える
to train oneself for a race―train for a race
腕を鍛える
to improve oneself in an art
腕を鍛え上げる
to perfect oneself in an art
英語を鍛える
to practise the students in English―drill the students in English―(自分でなら)―practise oneself in English.
胆力を鍛える
to train the powers of manhood
彼は始めから実地に鍛え上げたのだ
He has been trained to practical business from the first.
苦労で鍛え上げた人間だ
He has been trained in the school of adversity.

content:

content.content: 京都の着倒れ、東京の食い倒れ
The Kyoto people ruin themselves by extravagance in dress, the Tokyo people by extravagance in food.

content:
きたかぜ〔北風〕

content.content: 肌切るような北風
a cutting north wind

〈名〉The north side:(=に) on the north side (of the street, etc.)

きたきりすずめ〔着た切り雀〕
〈熟語〉To have only the clothes on his back; to have only the clothes one stands up in; to carry about all one's clothes with one

content:
きたく〔寄託〕
〈名〉Deposit:(=する) to deposit (anything with a person)

content.content: 寄託物、寄託品
a deposit
寄託証書
a deposit-certificate

content:
きたく〔帰宅〕
〈名〉Return home:(=する) to return home; to come home; to go home; get home; to be home

content.content: 彼はほどなく帰宅するでしょう
He will be home presently.

きだけ〔着丈〕
〈名〉The length (of a gown)

content:
きたす〔来す〕
〈他動〉To cause (a disaster); to occasion (a calamity); to work (a change); to bring about (a result); to produce (a result); to lead to (some result); to result in (a failure); to end in (a failure); to give rise to (evil)

content.content: 不注意の結果災難をきたした
Carelessness caused the calamity―occasioned the disaster.
失敗をきたした原因は何か
What caused the failure?―What was the cause of the failure?
戦争がどういう結果をきたすかと思って心配しておった
I was anxious as to what result the war would produce―lead to―bring about.
戦争が好結果をきたした
The war has produced good results―The war has been productive of good results.
意外な結果をきたした
The war has led to unexpected results―brought about strange results.
人選のことから内部に不和をきたした
The choice of men gave rise to friction―led to friction―among the members.
これらの事情は彼の人格に一大変化をきたした
These circumstances worked a great change in his character.
計画は一頓座をきたした
The plan met with a check―sustained a check.
戦争が始まると株屋が恐慌をきたした
The stock-jobbers were seized with a panic at the outbreak of war―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The outbreak of war threw the stock-jobbers into a panic.
英国今日の盛運をきたしたものは鉄と石炭である
Coal and iron have made England what she is.

きだち〔木太刀〕
〈名〉A wooden sword

きだち〔木立ち〕
〈名〉A thicket; a grove; a plantation; a boscage

content:
