〈形〉Just come; newly arrived; just from(abroad); fresh from (the country, etc.)

content.content: 僕は東京へ来たてだ
I have only just come to Tokyo.
東京へ来たてにはひどい目に逢った
I had a hard time of it when I first came to Tokyo.
あの男は店へ来たてだから何もわからない
He is new to the business and up to nothing.
あの西洋人は米国から来たてだ
He is just from America.
この女中は田舎から来たてだ
The servant is fresh from the country.
あれは来たての人だ
He is a new comer―a new arrival.

content:
きだて〔気立て〕
〈名〉Heart; temper; disposition; a cast of mind

content.content: 彼女は気だては好いが気が利かない
She has a good heart, but no head.
気だてが優しい
She has a tender heart.
気だてが柔和だ
She has a sweet temper―a mild disposition.
気だての好い男だ
He is a good-hearted man―His heart is in the right place.
妙な気だての人だ
He has a singular cast of mind.

content:
きたない〔汚い〕
〈形〉
1. (=不潔な)dirty; filthy; foul; unclean; soiled; nasty; squalid

content.content: 汚い通りだ
It is a dirty street.
汚い着物
dirty clothes-soiled clothes
汚い豚小舎
a filthy pig-sty
あれは非常に汚い所だ
That is a nasty place.
汚い乞食小舎
a squalid hovel
汚い病
a foul disease―an unclean disease
汚い原稿
a foul copy
汚い金銭
filthy lucre
食事中そんな汚い話をするな
That is no subject for table-talk.
着物を汚くする
to soil one's clothes―(糞便でなら)―dirty one's clothes
寝床を汚くする
to dirty one's bed

content: 2. (=卑猥な)indecent; obscene; ribald; filthy; foul; nasty

content.content: 汚い話
a filthy story―a nasty story―a ribald story―an obscene story―an indecent story
彼は汚い言葉を使う
He uses foul language―filth language.
汚い悪口
foul abuse
あの人は汚い物が好きだ
He has filthy tastes.

content: 3. (=卑劣な)mean; base; low; unworthy; sordid; dirty

content.content: 金をくれとは汚い
It is mean of him to ask for money.
彼は心が汚い
He has a base mind―a sordid spirit.
精神が汚い
He acts from base motives―low motives―unworthy motives.
汚い手段を用いる
He resorts to dirty tricks.
汚い相撲を取る
to resort to dirty tricks in wrestling

content: 4. (=吝嗇)stingy; niggardly; miserly; parsimonious; close-fisted

content.content: 彼は金使いが汚い
He is stingy with his money―niggardly with his money―unwilling to part with his money.
金持ちと灰吹きはたまればたまるほど汚い
“Muck and money go together.”

きたなくする〔汚くする〕
〈他動〉To soil (one's clothes):(糞便でなら)to dirty (one's clothes or bed); to foul (a nest, etc.)

きたならしい〔汚らしい〕
〈形〉Filthy (pig-sty); squalid (hovel); nasty (place); shabby (clothes); frowzy (peasant); slatternly (woman); dirty-looking (labourer, etc.)

きたのかた〔北の方〕
〈名〉(A nobleman's)lady

content:
きたままで〔着た儘で〕
〈副〉In one's clothes; in the clothes one stands up in

content.content: 着物を着たままで寝た
I slept in my clothes.

content:
きたむき〔北向き〕
〈名〉Northern aspect

content.content: この室は北向きだから冬は寒い
The room faces the north―looks toward the north―and is cold in winter.

content:
ぎだゆう〔義太夫〕
〈名〉The Japanese drama

content.content: 義太夫を語る
to recite a Gidayu
義太夫語り
a Gidayu-reciter

content:
きたる〔来る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=くる)to come

content.content: 友遠方より来たり
A friend comes from afar.
来る者は拒まず去る者は追わず
They are free to come and go.
笑う門には福来たる
Fortune comes in at the merry gate―(に相当するは)―“Laugh and grow fat.”

content: 2. (=起因する)to come (of something)

content.content: 彼の病気は過度の飲酒より来たる
His illness comes of drinking too much.
失敗は怠慢より来たる
Failure comes of negligence.
禍にして怠惰より来たざるは無し
All evil comes of idleness.

content: 〈形〉Coming; next

content.content: 来たる月曜より始む
It begins next Monday―on Monday next.
来たる四月より実行す
It will take effect next April―in April next.
来たる二十五日開会す
The meeting will be held on the 25th inst.
来たる出来事を待つ
I await the coming event.

content:
きたん〔忌憚〕
〈名〉Reserve→『

content.content: きたんなく〔忌憚無く〕

content:
きだん〔奇談〕
〈名〉An anecdote; an episode; an adventure

content.content: 奇談の多い人だ
His life is full of anecdotes.
戦争奇談
episodes of the war
彼は旅行中の奇談を物語った
He related his adventures on his journey.

content:
ぎだん〔疑団〕
〈名〉One's doubts

content.content: 疑団を解く
to dispel one's doubts―resolve one's doubts―clear one's doubts
ご講義を承って疑団が氷解した
On hearing your lecture, my doubts have been cleared―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your lecture has cleared my doubts.

content:
きたんなく〔忌憚無く〕
〈副〉Without reserve; unreservedly; freely; frankly; candidly

content.content: 忌憚無くお話しなさい
You may speak without reserve―You may speak freely.
好いか悪いか忌憚無く言って下さい
Tell me frankly what you think of it.
忌憚無くご批評を願います
I want a candid criticism.
忌憚無く意見を述べる
to have the courage of one's opinions

content:
きち〔危地〕
〈名〉A perilous position; a critical situation; danger; peril

content.content: 彼は危地に在り
He is in danger―in a perilous position―in a critical situation.
危地に陥る
to run into danger
危地に入る
to run into the jaws of death―put one's head into a lion's mouth
生命を危地に置く
to expose one's life to danger―imperil one's life
危地に臨んで冷静自若たり
He is cool and steady in presence of danger.
危地を脱する
to get out of danger

content:
きち〔既知〕
〈形〉Known

content.content: 既知数
a known quantity

content:
きち〔機智〕
〈名〉Wit

content.content: 機知に富む
to be witty

content:
きち〔吉〕
〈形〉Good; lucky; joyful; auspicious

content.content: 大吉
great luck
吉日
a lucky day
吉兆
a good omen
吉報
good news―joyful tidings―a favourable answer
吉事
a lucky event―a joyful event―an auspicious event
上々吉
great good luck
万事上々吉
All goes very well―All goes on wheels―All goes on swimmingly.
首尾は上々吉
We are in the best of luck.

content:
きちがい〔気違い〕
〈名〉
1. (=狂気)madness; insanity; lunacy

content.content: 気違いになる
to go mad―go crazy―become insane―be bereft of reason―lose one's wits―go off one's head―go out of one's mind―go out of one's senses
彼は気違いになった
He is mad―crazy―insane―bereft of reason―off his head―out of his senses―out of his mind―not in his right mind.
挙動が変だから気違いにでもなりはせぬかと思った
I feared for his reason.
気違いにする
to drive one mind
彼は気違いにでもなったかと思うほどくやしがった
He nearly went mad with vexation―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Vexation nearly drove him mad.
彼は本気違いだ
He is stark mad―raving mad.
彼らの熱心は気違いに近い
Their zeal borders on madness―verges on insanity.
彼は気違いのようになって行きたがっている
He is mad to go―wild to go.
気違病院
a madhouse―a lunatic asylum
気違日和
fickle weather
酒は気違い水
“Drunkenness is a voluntary madness.”

content: 2. (=狂人)a madman; a lunatic; a maniac; an insane person; a crazy person; a bedlamite

content.content: あの人は気違いだ
He is mad―a madman.
気違いが暴れまわる
A madman raves about―A madman rips and tears about.
気違いに刃物
Do not place an edge-tool in the hands of a madman.
彼はばかか気違いだ
He must be a fool or a madman.
ばかと気違いはよけて通せ
Make way for a fool and a madman.
彼は気違いのような振舞をする
He behaves like one possessed.

content: 3. (=熱狂)mania; fanaticism:(熱狂者) a maniac; a fanatic; an enthusiast; a zealot

content.content: 宗教気違い
(人)a fanatic―(事)―fanaticism
書物気違い
(人)a bibliomaniac―(事)―bibliomania
芝居気違い
(人)a theatremaniac―(事)―theatremania
英国気違い
(人)an Anglomaniac―(事)―Anglomania
日本気違い
(人)a Japanomaniac―(事)―Japanomania
彼は戦争気違いだ
He is war-mad―war-crazy.

content:
きちがいじみた〔気違いじみた〕
〈形〉Fantastic; fanatical

content.content: 彼は気違いじみた身なりをしている
He is fantastically dressed―in a fantastic dress.
気違いじみた真似をする
He behaves like one possessed.
彼らの熱心は気違いじみている
Their zeal borders on madness―verges on insanity―They are fanatical.
気違いじみた考えだ
It is a mad idea.

ぎちぎちする〔ギチギチする〕
〈自動〉(=引戸などがギチギチする)(A sliding-door) creaks

ぎちぎちする〔ギチギチする〕
〈自動〉(=引戸などがギチギチする)(A sliding-door) creaks

content:
きちじ〔吉事〕
〈名〉A joyful event; a lucky event; an auspicious event

content.content: 俗説に蜘蛛が下がると吉事があると言う
It is a common saying that a hanging spider is a lucky sign.

きちずい〔吉瑞〕
〈名〉A good omen

content:
きちする〔窺知する〕
〈他動〉To know something of (anything); to form an idea of (an abstruse fact); to fathom (one's meaning, etc.)

content.content: 内部の消息は多少之を窺知するを得
We may know something of the internal state of things.
内部の消息は門外漢の窺知し得るところにあらず
The internal state of affairs is a sealed book to the outsider.
天道は窺知すべからず
Inscrutable are the ways of Heaven―Heaven is a sealed book to us.
その生活の一端を窺知することができる
We get a glance into their life―catch a glimpse of their life.
有史前のことは微かに窺知するを得べし
We can form a faint idea of the prehistoric times.
意味深長窺知すべからず
We can not fathom the meaning.

content:
きちにち〔吉日〕
〈名〉A lucky day; an auspicious day

content.content: 吉日を選んで婚礼をした
They fixed upon a lucky day for the wedding.
思い立ったが吉日
There is no time like the present.

content:
きちゃく〔帰着〕
〈名〉
1. (=着すること)arrival:(=する) to arrive at (a conclusion); to come to (a conclusion)

content.content: どういう順序を経てその断定に帰着したのか
What are the steps by which you arrived at that conclusion?
議論紛々、帰着するところを知らず
There is a great divergence of opinion, and no conclusion can be arrived at.
両者の議論はつまり同じことに帰着する
Both arguments come to the same thing after all.

content: 2. (=帰り)return:(=する) to return

content.content: 昨日無事帰着
I returned in safety yesterday.

content:
きちゅう〔忌中〕
〈名〉Mourning

content.content: あの家では主人が死んで忌中だ

content:
きちょう〔基調〕
〈名〉Key-note

content:
きちょう〔帰朝〕
〈名〉Return from abroad:(=する) to return from abroad

According to a man lately returned from America, there seems to be a rage for preparedness throughout the land.
帰朝を命ぜらる
I am ordered home.
帰朝の途に就く
to leave for home
氏は近々帰朝のはず
He is expected home shortly.
新帰朝者(帰朝したばかりの人)
a man just returned from abroad

〈名〉Entry:(=する) to make an entry; to enter in a book

content:

〈形〉Precious (time); dear (life); valuable (article); invaluable (aid); priceless (treasure)

Time is precious.

誰も生命は貴重だ
Life is dear to everybody―Everybody holds life dear.
ラクダは砂漠の住民には貴重なものだ
The camel is valuable to―invaluable to―of great value to―the dweller of the desert.
好い性質は貴重な賜物だ
A happy disposition is a precious gift―a priceless gift.
女の操は貴重な宝である
Female honour is a priceless treasure.

きちょう〔几帳〕
〈名〉A cloth screen

content:
ぎちょう〔議長〕
〈名〉The president (of a deliberative assembly); the chairman (of a meeting); the Speaker (of the House of Commons)

content.content: 議長になる
to preside at a meeting―take the chair
昨夜は誰が議長になったか
Who was elected chairman―Who was in the chair―Who presided―at last night's meeting?
可否同数なる時は議長に裁決権あり
When the votes are equally divided, the president has the casting-vote.
貴族院議長
the President of the House of Peers
衆議院議長
the Speaker of the House of Representatives
県会議長
the president of a prefectural assembly

content:
きちょうひん〔貴重品〕
〈名〉A valuable article:(総称すれば)valuables

content.content: 貴重品は亭主が保管している
The valuables are in the custody of the landlord.

content:
きちょうめん〔几帳面〕
〈形〉Methodical (man); precise (in everything); exact (to the cent); punctual (to the minute); punctilious (manners); scrupulous (honesty); square (accounts); square-toed (person); orderly (man of business):(=に) precisely; exactly; punctually; scrupulously; to the minute; to the cent; to the letter; on the square

content.content: あれはきちょうめんな人だ
He is a methodical man―a precisian―a square-toes.
勘定がきちょうめんだ
The accounts are exact (to the cent).
取引がきちょうめんだ
He is exact (to the cent) in his dealings.
きちょうめんに時間を守る
He is punctual to the minute.
ばかばかしいほどきちょうめんに礼儀を守る
He is punctilious to an absurd extent.
ごく細かいことまできちょうめんに注意する
He gives scrupulous attention to the minutest details.
きちょうめんに命令を守る
He obeys orders to the letter.
文法がきちょうめんだ
He is a stickler for grammar.
何をするにもきちょうめんだ
He does everything on the square.

content:
きちれい〔吉例〕
〈名〉A good custom; an auspicious custom; a time-honoured-custom

content.content: その日は吉例として学校は休業した
According to custom, the school was closed on the day.

content:
きちんと〔キチンと〕
〈副〉Exactly; precisely; accurately; to a nicety; to a T; like clockwork:(勘定なら) exact to the cent:(時間なら) punctually; on the stroke; sharp; to the minute:(=した) neat, smart (clothes); tidy (room); trim (dress); tight (ship); spruce, smug (air); (a room) in good order; spick-and-span:(=する) to tidy (oneself); to trim (oneself) up; to put (a room) in order; to put (a room) to rights

content.content: この上衣は君にキチンと合う
The coat fits you to a nicety―fits you to a T―fits you like wall-paper.
キチンと合う帽子
a close-fitting cap
この時計はキチンと合う
This watch keeps exact time.
あの人は八時というとキチンとやって来る
He appears punctually at eight―at eight to the minute.
時間はキチンと六時ですよ
The time is precisely six―six sharp.
時間にキチンと間に合った
I was there on the stroke.
彼はキチンと時間を守る
He is punctual to the minute.
キチンと払う
He is punctual with his payment.
勘定がキチンと合う
The accounts are exact to the cent.
あの人は取引がキチンとしている
He is exact to the cent in his dealings.
あの人は支度がキチンとしている
He is neatly dressed―smartly dressed―tidily dressed―trimly dressed―in spick-and-span clothes.
着物をキチンとしておれ
Keep yourself neat―Keep yourself smart―Keep yourself tidy―Keep yourself trim.
着物をキチンとなさい
Tidy yourself―Trim yourself up―Smarten yourself up.
あの人のふうはいやにキチンとしている
He has a spruce air―a smug air.
座敷をキチンとしよう
I will tidy up the room―put the room in order―put the room to rights.
室内がキチンと整頓している
The room is in apple-pie order.
万事キチンとしている
All works like clockwork.

content:
きちんやど〔木賃宿〕
〈名〉A doss-house

content.content: 木賃宿の客
a dosser

content:
きつい
〈形〉
1. (=強い)strong; brave; manly; heroic

content.content: きつい人だ
He is a heroic man.
おおきつい、泣くんじゃないよ
Be a man! Don't cry!
坊やはきついね
You are a little man.

content: 2. (=強烈)strong

content.content: きつい酒
strong wine
きついタバコ
strong tobacco

content: 3. (=窮屈)tight

content.content: この靴はきつい
These shoes are too tight.
この靴はきつくてなかなか入らぬ
I can not get these shoes on, they are too small.

content:
きつえん〔喫煙〕
〈名〉Smoking:(=する) to smoke

content.content: 喫煙を禁ず
Smoking prohibited―No smoking.
末丁年者は喫煙を禁じられている
Minors are prohibited from smoking.

きつえんしつ〔喫煙室〕
〈名〉A smoking-room

きつえんしゃ〔喫煙車〕
〈名〉(英国にては)a smoking-compartment:(米国にては)a smoking-car

content:
きっか〔菊花〕

content.content: 菊花の御紋章
the Imperial crest of the chrysanthemum
菊花大綬章
the Grand Cordon of the Chrysanthemum

content:
きづかい〔気遣い〕
〈名〉Anxiety; uneasiness:(以下打消のほかは複数) fears; apprehensions

content.content: 君は落第する気づかいは無い
There is no fear of your failing.
雨の降る気づかいは無い
There is no fear of its raining.
この空なら雨の降る気づかいは無い
The sky shows no sign of rain.
彼が大臣になる気づかいは無い
There is no fear of his becoming a minister―He has no chance of becoming a minister.
青天井は落ちる気づかい無し(と乞食言う)
There is no fear of the sky falling―no danger of the sky falling.
大丈夫そんな気づかいは無い
There is no fear of that―no need for such fears―no need for such apprehensions.
そんな気づかいは要らないからご安心なさい
You need not make yourself uneasy―You may make yourself easy―set your heart at ease―set your mind at rest.
